2025-09-01.content: Life sometimes leads us through valleys of darkness, filled with challenges, losses, and uncertainties. Psalm 23, also known as the "Shepherd Psalm," offers a message of God's care and presence during hardships, including lack and poverty. God, our Shepherd, provides for us so that we will not lack anything. He knows the terrain and will guide us to "green pastures" and "quiet waters" to replenish our spirit. We are encouraged to acknowledge our fears and challenges as the first step toward healing. The Shepherd promises to walk with us through the valley, not to remove it. God's presence is a constant source of comfort and strength, reminding us that we are not alone. The challenges will end, and a future filled with goodness, love, and an eternal dwelling place with God awaits. Holding on to this hope reminds us that our struggles are not the end and a brighter future awaits.
2025-09-01.prayer: Heavenly Father, please help me walk through my challenges and struggles.

2025-09-02.content: The people of Judah had returned from exile but neglected to rebuild the temple, preferring their own comfortable lives. They believed it wasn't the right time to rebuild the temple, but God saw their comfortable lives as misplaced priorities. The neglected temple symbolized their lack of devotion and appreciation for God's presence. Through the prophet Haggai, God challenged their lack of concern and urged them to consider their priorities and refocus their energy on rebuilding the temple. God reminded them that their lack of focus on rebuilding the temple resulted in a lack of blessing in their personal lives. We are asked if we are so focused on our comfort that we neglect things of greater importance, such as our relationship with God and service to others. While striving for a good life is important, neglecting our spiritual lives can lead to emptiness and a lack of fulfillment. Just as the people of Judah were called to rebuild the temple, God calls us today to take action and rearrange our priorities. We are challenged to "Consider your ways!".
2025-09-02.prayer: Father, forgive me for preferring my comfort over your work and affairs, Amen!

2025-09-03.content: Today's passage from Haggai offers guidance for when we make our best efforts but don't see the desired results. The passage begins with God urging Israel to examine their actions and priorities. After they do this, God instructs them to "Go up into the mountains, bring down timber, and build my house" (v.8). God recommended a shift from observation to action because reflection without action can lead to stagnation. The Israelites experienced a lack despite their efforts, and God explained this as a consequence of their focus on personal gain while neglecting his house. The drought and hardship they experienced were the result of their neglect. When we face challenges or a lack of fulfillment, we are told to take time to reflect on our actions and priorities. Reflection should be followed by action, and we should identify the changes we need to make to align our lives with God's will and actively pursue them. If we are unsure where to start, we should seek guidance from trusted spiritual leaders, mentors, or faith communities.
2025-09-03.prayer: Dear Lord, please give me the grace to retrace my steps and re-align my priorities, Amen!

2025-09-04.content: Today's text describes a turning point for the people of Judah when they obeyed the voice of the Lord their God (v.12). Having heard God's word, they shifted their focus and took action, highlighting the importance of not just listening but also acting on what we hear. God's response to their obedience was, "I am with you, declares the Lord" (v.13). The passage describes the positive outcomes of their obedience: their hearts were motivated to act and continue on the path of obedience with a deeper reverence for God. We are encouraged not to remain stagnant when we hear God's voice, but to take the first step toward what we believe God is asking of us, no matter how small. We are told to trust that as we move forward, He will be our guide and companion. Faith without action is like an unwatered seed, and we are encouraged to be the fertile ground where God's word can blossom into meaningful action. Small steps of obedience can lead to significant changes in our lives and strengthen our relationship with God. We are told to trust that He is with us and to take the first step toward living according to His will today.
2025-09-04.action: Reflect, Refocus and Realign your actions on building a lasting relationship with God.

2025-09-05.topic: THOUGH YOU MAY REMEMBER BUT DON'T DWELL ON YOUR PAST
2025-09-05.content: In this passage, Haggai asks the people, "Who is left among you who saw this house in its former glory?" (v.3). This comparison between the magnificent former temple and its current, less impressive state might have brought feelings of regret and discouragement. However, God doesn't dwell on the past but encourages his people to move beyond it and focus on the blessings He promises in the present and future. It's okay to acknowledge and learn from the past, but dwelling on it can hinder our present and future growth. God's presence and blessings are available to us today, regardless of past experiences or circumstances. We are encouraged to focus on what we can control and how we can contribute to building something positive in the present. We shouldn't wait for ideal circumstances to begin building anew but should start with small, intentional steps, trusting that God will bless and guide our efforts. The text reminds us that while the past shapes who we are, it doesn't define our potential. By shifting our focus from comparing what is gone to present action and trusting in God's presence, we can embrace opportunities for growth and rebuild what is before us.
2025-09-05.action: Put your past in the past and focus on your present while trusting God for the future.

2025-09-06.content: The Israelites felt discouraged by the temple's current state compared to its former glory. They might have questioned the value of their efforts, given the seemingly impossible task of rebuilding. In today's text, God offers reassurance despite their concerns. He encourages them to "be strong" and reminds them of his covenant, emphasizing his presence and unwavering support. The passage doesn't ignore the difficulties but offers a powerful promise: the shaking wasn't meant to destroy, but to prepare them for something new. This can be interpreted as a symbol of change and transformation, reminding us that God can use even difficult times to pave the way for something better. Verse 7 speaks of a time when "the desire of all nations" will come and fill the temple with glory, suggesting a future gathering of people from all backgrounds united in their reverence for God. The passage concludes with the promise that "The glory of this latter house will be greater than the glory of the former house" (v.9). Haggai's message reminds us that even in the face of difficulties and negative circumstances, God promises hope and a greater future glory. We are encouraged to hold onto this hope, embrace change, and actively contribute to building a brighter future, trusting in God's presence and guidance every step of the way.
2025-09-06.prayer: Dear Lord, let your glory fill my path and shine on my dark path, Amen!

2025-09-07.topic: PRAYING IN THE POWER OF THE HOLY SPIRIT
2025-09-07.content: Prayer is an essential aspect of the Christian life and a successful Christian journey is almost impossible without a healthy prayer life. Prayer is not just asking, but an act of relating and remaining in relationship with God. It is how we spiritually commune and connect with our heavenly Father and is one of the most effective weapons of our warfare. For our prayer to be effective, it must be done correctly and for the right purposes. The only correct, appropriate, and divinely approved prayer is the one done in the power of the Holy Spirit. As humans, we are physically weak, which often prevents us from praying, even when we desire to. We are also emotionally weak and don't know the correct needs to pray for, sometimes praying for things to fulfill lustful desires, selfish gain, and the satisfaction of ego. To pray correctly, we need the assistance and guidance of the Holy Spirit. We need the Holy Spirit to do the actual praying for us. To gain access to the Holy Spirit, we must allow the Spirit of God to dwell in us as we manifest the fruits of the Holy Spirit daily. Praying in tongues is another way the Holy Spirit helps our weaknesses in prayer; therefore, we need to thirst and hunger for the gift of praying in tongues.
2025-09-07.prayer: Heavenly father, according to your promise, fill me with the power of the Holy Spirit in Jesus' Name.

2025-09-08.content: Today is the 'Nativity of the Blessed Virgin Mary.' Mary took a significant and memorable part in the fulfillment of God's plan for the universe and humanity. Through her, the work of human salvation was achieved through Jesus Christ. She conceived and gave birth to the eternal King whose kingdom will have no end. Mary is a significant figure in the Christian faith, but she should not be idolized or viewed as an object of worship. Although only God knows exactly why she was so favored and chosen, some suggest it was because she was a chaste virgin with sound morality, was very humble and simple-hearted, and had the Lord God of Israel as her Saviour. Today, God still has plans for the world, but to fulfill them, He looks for people who are prepared and morally sound, humble, and dedicated to service. If we are willing and ready to take part in God's plans, we should follow the example of Mary's life of humility, holiness, and followership of God.
2025-09-08.prayer: Lord, here I am: Take me, break me, remould me and use me - Amen.

2025-09-09.content: In today's text, two questions were asked of the Priests. The first was whether a garment used to bear Holy Meat would become clean by touching Holy Meat, to which the answer was no. The second question was whether something unclean (by touching a dead body) can make something else clean (holy) become unclean, to which the answer was yes, meaning the unclean thing will defile a clean thing. The point emphasized by these questions is that it's easier to become unclean than to be made clean. As we interact with people and our environment, we need to be careful not to be defiled by immoral people we relate with. Some things that easily cause defilement are evil association and some often-overlooked sinful habits. The world today is full of wicked and sinful people whose lives are corrupted by habitual, ungodly, and criminal lifestyles. Some of these people give to charity, thinking they can use good works to erase their sins or make themselves clean, but this is not possible. The sure way to be cleansed from the guilt of sin is by honest confession, genuine repentance, and cleansing by the blood of the lamb.
2025-09-09.prayer: Dear Lord, I rely on the blood of Christ for my cleansing. Help me daily to live by the power of your Holy Spirit and to remain undefiled, Amen.

2025-09-10.topic: HOLY ZEAL TO DO GOD'S WILL
2025-09-10.content: This text builds on the preceding one, showing the people of Israel as unclean because they were selfish, laboring to build their own houses and please themselves while neglecting God's house. God told them that even though they claimed to have repented by laying the foundation of the temple, they would still suffer and endure the consequences of their sins for a moment. However, after their repentance and restitution, their situations would begin to change for the better. The penalty for their sin would eventually be removed, and a time of peace and joy would soon come. Sometimes the difficulties and challenges we face are a result of our disobedience and indifference to God's work. For example, financial hardship, debt, and business decline can be the result of not paying tithes and offerings. Likewise, certain physical health challenges may be a result of unconfessed and hidden sin. The good news is that we have the assurance of God's forgiveness and total restoration if we consider our ways and return to Him in sincere repentance. After our repentance, a moment of patience is needed as the time of punishment gradually winds off and we are fully restored.
2025-09-10.prayer: O Lord my God, give me the passion to obey you and to do your wish at all times, Amen!

2025-09-11.topic: GOD'S ULTIMATE PURPOSE: HIS ETERNAL KINGDOM
2025-09-11.content: The message in today's passage was addressed to Zerubbabel, governor of Judah, when they returned from the Babylonian captivity. The prophecy speaks of a future time when God would destroy all human kingdoms on earth to establish an everlasting kingdom ruled by His Messiah. In this text, Zerubbabel is used as a symbolic representation of the Messiah, the Eternal King to come. As Zerubbabel was the initial leader of the exiles, Jesus, of the Davidic dynasty, will be the Deliverer of all who seek to escape from the captivity of sin. He will lead those who desire freedom from the bondage of sin and rule over them forever. The headquarters of his kingdom will be the new Jerusalem coming down from heaven and it will be established above all kingdoms. Jesus will reign as King from heaven over the whole universe. To qualify for His kingdom, one must be born again, set free from the slavery of sin, and walk by faith in Jesus and obedience to his leadership. This should be the ultimate goal of all believers.
2025-09-11.prayer: Lord, set me free from the bondage of sin and make me fit for your eternal kingdom.

2025-09-12.topic: A BURDEN FOR THE WORD OF GOD
2025-09-12.content: The word "burden" comes from a Hebrew word that means 'to lift up.' Therefore, a burden for the word of God means 'lifting the word of God'. The author of the Epistle to the Hebrews reveals that in ancient times, God spoke through the prophets, but in these last days, He chose to speak to us through His Son, Jesus Christ. The word of God through the prophets and later through Jesus was in perfect harmony. The word is of two kinds: 'foretelling' and 'forth-telling'. To forth-tell is to reveal God's will, mind, law, and instructions through verbal or written proclamation. To foretell is to reveal God's plans, program, and purpose for humanity and the entire universe. Jesus Christ, who is the word of God, came into the world and revealed God's mind and law. He also made known God's plans and purpose for the whole world. He called everyone to repentance and faith in God and revealed the ultimate purpose and plan of God for the salvation of mankind. His followers are called to proclaim this gospel. When Jesus ascended into heaven, he handed over the work of proclaiming the word of God to us. It is a divine obligation for all true followers of Christ to bear the burden of preaching the word of God at all times and in all places, to the end of the world.
2025-09-12.prayer: O Lord create in me holy zeal and burden to be an oracle of your word, Amen!

2025-09-13.content: The Lord we serve is holy and should be honored, reverenced, and approached with the highest level of awe. His name should not be profaned. In this passage, the priests of the Lord were charged with sacrilege and disregard for holy things. They offered abominable sacrifices on God's altar, which was an abomination to God and His people. They offered animals that were torn, lame, sick, or maimed, which was a violation of God's prescription concerning offerings. Today, many of our altars are polluted with different forms of abominable sacrifices. Many priests, who should be custodians of the altar, are 'Strangers in the Sanctuary' because they have no salvation experience and their hands are soiled with sin. Many songs we sing and prayers we offer today are nothing but abominable sacrifices. When we offer polluted sacrifices to God, terrible consequences will follow, as seen in the case of Nadab and Abihu, who offered strange fire before the Lord. We can also learn from Cain, whose offering was rejected because it was faulty, unlike Abel's, which was accepted. Our offering will be acceptable if we first offer our bodies to God as a living sacrifice.
2025-09-13.prayer: Lord, I offer my body a living sacrifice, let me be acceptable in your sight and help me to live to please you, Amen!

2025-09-14.content: The cross is Christ's emblem of suffering, shame, and death. A believer in Christ should not be ashamed of his cross but should rather glory in it, as Apostle Paul said. Jesus also says, "If any man will come after me, let him deny himself first, and take up his cross daily, and follow me". There is a popular saying: "No cross, no crown". On the cross, Jesus Christ suffered beyond description, but He also conquered sin, self, satan, and all challenges that are man's problems, including curses, sicknesses, diseases, failures, and death. Furthermore, it was on the cross that Christ brought salvation to those who believe in him. Paul referred to 'the enemies of the cross' as those who do not walk according to the mind of Christ but according to the desires of the flesh. Jesus received the greatest honor because He surrendered himself, despised the shame, and died the meanest of forms of death. Paul said, "God forbids that I should glory except in the cross of our Lord Jesus Christ". Any man identified with the cross of Christ has the world and its evil desires crucified with him and is risen to a new life of holiness and righteousness with him. A crucified life is a dignified and glorified one, and we are encouraged not to dodge the cross but to carry it gallantly, as the blessings attached to it await us.

2025-09-15.content: Life in the Spirit is a life in which the Spirit of God dwells and consequently directs the life of the believer who has genuinely surrendered his/her life to the Lordship of Jesus Christ. Such a life is empowered by the Holy Spirit to overcome the lustful desires of the flesh and can mortify the deeds of the body. The presence of the Spirit of God in a person serves as proof that they are a child of God. The Spirit of God bears witness with our Spirit that we are children of God, and such are heirs of God and joint heirs with Christ. Being joint heirs with Christ qualifies believers to enjoy the great inheritance that we have in God. This inheritance is manifested in two ways: first in the glory that shall be revealed to the world and second in the suffering the believer will have to go through for the sake of his faith. There is no condemnation to believers who are in Christ Jesus and who walk not after the flesh but after the Spirit. If you are not a part of this group, you can become a member by surrendering your life to Jesus Christ and asking Him to become the Lord of your life and thus put the Spirit of God inside of you.
2025-09-15.prayer: Dear Lord I submit my heart to you afresh, please come into my heart and fill me with your spirit in Jesus name, Amen.

2025-09-16.content: In our text, Apostle Paul makes it clear that the Gospel, which is Jesus Christ, is the power of God. God's power is to reconcile and restore man, and can only be traced back to Jesus Christ, who has been since the foundation of the world. Paul also described Jesus Christ in the last part of verse 24 of our text as the wisdom of God. Power and wisdom are essential in life for anybody who wants to succeed here and beyond. We will be powerless, foolish, and unfulfilled if Jesus Christ is absent in our lives because worldly wisdom is foolishness to God. Therefore, in all our ambitions in life, we must acknowledge the Lord Jesus Christ in our lives so our existence can be meaningful and impactful. The level of our academic attainment or exposure is vanity if Jesus Christ is not in our lives. Since the power and wisdom of God is Jesus Christ, then anyone aiming to see God at the end must do away with sinful living and surrender all to Jesus Christ, who is the power and wisdom of God.
2025-09-16.prayer: Oh Lord, turn my foolishness to wisdom through Jesus Christ, Amen!.

2025-09-17.content: Today's passage is part of Paul's letter to the Philippians, where he addresses concerns about unity, joy, and Christian living. In verses 15-16, he calls for the Philippians to follow his example and those living faithfully. In the same way, we are to follow the examples of Saints in their commitment and faithful living. We must intentionally live with the purpose of modeling our lives to follow the pattern of Jesus Christ. Verses 17-21 expand on this, contrasting those who follow Christ and those who live for earthly things. Apostle Paul presents a clear choice before the believers - either to live for this world or the Kingdom of Heaven. He further challenges all believers to examine their priorities and motivations. Our priorities determine who we are. As heavenly citizens, our focus must be on the things of heaven. We must note that true fulfillment comes only from belonging to God's eternal kingdom and living for that purpose alone. This doesn't mean that we will neglect our earthly responsibilities but rather we find our ultimate meaning in Christ and live a balanced life, using all resources around us to fulfill the purpose of getting to heaven. We hope that though our bodies may be limited, we await a future transformation, becoming like Christ in glory. This provides comfort and hope, especially in difficult times.
2025-09-17.prayer: Dear Lord, please grant me grace to love you and live for your purpose only, Amen!.

2025-09-18.topic: I WILL DRAW ALL MEN UNTO MYSELF
2025-09-18.content: Imagine this scene: Jesus, surrounded by a crowd, speaks boldly about his upcoming death. The world saw the crucifixion of Jesus as a defeat but Jesus saw it as a means of victory. Instead of lamenting his fate, He declares with confidence "If I be lifted up, I will draw all men to myself". Christ's lifting here is not of the humiliating death on the cross but of a deeper meaning, symbolising Jesus' purpose - to offer himself as a sacrifice for the salvation of mankind. This reveals the heart of God's love and redemption plan. Jesus didn't shy away from his crucifixion, He saw it as the transformative power of sacrifice, and not humiliation. In the earlier chapter (8:12), Jesus described himself as "The light of the world," without which anyone who walks, is in darkness. Phos is a Greek word for light, meaning anything that produces brightness. Light is anything that reveals things or makes them manifest. Darkness is the absence of darkness. According to John Piper, "The light of Christ is the brightness of God shining on the retina of the human soul". He is the light to both the Jews and the Gentiles. Isaiah describes the desperate and hopeless state of a man without Jesus, the Light. Beloved, will you be drawn to this wonderful love? Have you tasted Calvary? Today is the day, tomorrow may be too late!.
2025-09-18.prayer: Father, I submit to your love take my heart let it be thine own.

2025-09-19.content: In reading today, Christ demonstrated the greatest form of humility by having laid aside the majesty of his former appearance as God and coming down in man's likeness to redeem us from our sinful nature. He emptied himself, was shed of the honours and glories of the upper world and clothed himself with human nature. One would have thought that the Lord Jesus if He would be a man, should have been a prince, and appeared in splendour. But quite the contrary, He took upon himself the form of a servant. His whole life was a life of humiliation, meanness, poverty, and disgrace; He had nowhere to lay his head.

2025-09-20.content: Apostle Paul in our text reminds us that though the Law is holy and perfect, everyone who does not keep the Law perfectly is cursed by it. This is because no one can, on his or her ability, obey the Law perfectly. There were over 600 laws the Jews had to keep so as to be right in the eyes of God; breaking one commandment put a person under condemnation. Therefore, achieving salvation through obedience to the Law is fruitless. As a result, all who tried to live by the Old Law were under a divine curse. The good news is that Christ, through his death on the cross, provided a way out of this curse, making the way for us to regain the favour of God. He did this by becoming a curse for us - for it is written, 'Cursed is everyone who is hangs on a tree.'. The curse of the law fell on Christ on our behalf so that the righteousness of God could fall on us, though we did not deserve it. He took away our sins and curses so that the blessings of Abraham might come to the Gentiles through him. Every man is condemned and cursed but the redemptive grace of Jesus brought us all into favour and blessings of God, and we can access this grace by believing in the Lord Jesus and living by faith to receive the blessings that accompany faithful observance of the law.
2025-09-20.prayer: Lord Jesus, I thank you for offering yourself to save me, I now ask for the grace to live for you for the rest of my life, Amen!.

2025-09-21.content: Matthew was a Jew appointed by the Romans to collect tax. He collected taxes from the citizens as well as from merchants passing through town. At the time, tax collectors were expected to take a commission on the taxes they collected, but most of them overcharged the people and kept the excess to themselves. As a result of this, they were hated by the Jews because of their reputation for cheating and because they supported Rome. Despite this, our Lord Jesus Christ still went for Matthew, a man who would have been regarded as an oppressor and a terrible sinner, by the Jews. Jesus hurt his reputation among the religious elites to reach out to those who were lost. We must all follow our Master's example by spreading the gospel to all without any discrimination - the poor, immoral, lonely and outcast, and not just the rich, moral, popular and powerful. We should not be afraid to reach out to people who are living in sin. God's message changes people and He is concerned for all people, including the sinful and hurting. Matthew, on hearing the call to abandon all and follow Jesus, got up and followed, leaving the so-called lucrative career, without any regret. Sometimes, the decision to follow Christ requires difficult or painful choices. But like Matthew, we must decide to leave behind those things that will keep us from following Jesus.
2025-09-21.prayer: Lord Jesus give me your spirit to love all and reach them with the gospel of peace.

2025-09-22.content: In chapter 12, Paul gave evidence of the Corinthians' lack of love in the use of spiritual gifts. Our text today shows that love is more important than all the spiritual gifts exercised in the body of Christ. Our text also describes God's kind of love, which is unselfish and goes against our natural beliefs and way of loving. This most excellent way is the way of kindness, longsuffering, and enduring evil, injury or provocation. In this way, pride and vainglory are subdued and there is no room for envy, hatred, malice, or revenge. Love is the fulfillment of all the laws of God and once we allow the love of God to spread over us, our hearts will be transformed and we will receive the impartation of the agape love. However, this will only be possible if we allow the light of the gospel to bring the knowledge of Christ to inspire faith and hope in us which will help us to set aside our natural desires so that we can love and not expect anything in return. Thus, the more we become like Christ, the more love we will show to others. This will help us to understand that love is the greatest of all human qualities and an attribute of God himself.
2025-09-22.prayer: Dear Father, please pour your love into my heart.

2025-09-23.topic: THE LIPS OF A PRIEST OUGHT TO PRESERVE KNOWLEDGE
2025-09-23.content: Malachi in our text offers a plain message directed at the priests of Israel. This message also holds valuable lessons for all of us called to leadership roles, whether within the church or in our daily lives. God entrusted the priests with the task of being guardians and teachers, ensuring God's instructions reached the people. However, God laments that the priests have scattered his instructions "to the wind" and "turned away" from the covenant. This neglect has consequences. God threatened to "curse their blessings" and "spread dung over their faces". As leaders, religious or secular, we hold a great responsibility. We are entrusted with guiding others, shaping their understanding, and setting an example. When we fail to uphold our responsibilities, the consequences can be great. We risk misleading those we are called to serve, and our influence can be tarnished. Our passage today highlights that the Levite priests of old were committed to their calling and served with integrity. Today's leaders are challenged to reflect on old-time faith and leaders, follow their example, embody the values they preach, and guide others with honesty and dedication. Our actions speak louder than words. If we don't live by the principles we advocate, we "cause many to stumble in the law".
2025-09-23.prayer: Dear God, help me to be faithful stewards of your word and grace, Amen!.

2025-09-24.content: The passage opens by reminding the Israelites of their shared origin and covenant with God. Despite this shared history and commitment, the people had been "betraying one another" and exhibiting disloyalty, both to their fellow humans and to God Himself. God described divorce as something He "hates". This statement speaks to the broader importance of honoring commitments and maintaining the sanctity of relationships. Whether it applies to marriage, friendships, or our covenant with God, breaking faith has significant consequences. The passage urges individuals to "guard yourselves in your spirits" and to avoid "breaking faith". This requires vigilance and self-awareness. We must be mindful of the promises we make and the impact our actions have on others. In what ways do you ensure you are living up to your commitments, both to others and to God?. Have there been times when you have broken faith with someone? How can you work towards healing those relationships? How can you cultivate a more positive and trusting relationship with God, even when faced with challenges or doubts?.
2025-09-24.prayer: Almighty God, forgive me for my broken promises and unfaithfulness. Help me to strengthen the relationships in my lives and cultivate a spirit of integrity.

2025-09-25.content: Our text today starts with a powerful image describing a messenger who will be sent to prepare the way for the Lord. This messenger has been identified to be John the Baptist, who proclaimed the coming of Jesus Christ in the New Testament and prepared the people for an encounter with Jesus. The eventual coming of the Lord is described as a refining fire and a purifying soap. This language speaks of judgment and transformation. Judgement in that every sin will be revealed and condemned. It is important to remember that God's refining fire is not meant to destroy us but to remove impurities and reveal the precious metal within. Just as a refiner carefully heats gold to separate it from dross, so does God work in our lives to remove sin and selfishness, leading us closer to his holiness. Through this refining process, we can become offerings that are pleasing to the Lord. Encountering Jesus through the purifying soap of his blood cleanses us from all sin and transforms our lives to please him while being ready for the Second Coming of the Lord.
2025-09-25.prayer: Lord help me to embrace your refining fire, knowing that it leads to greater purity and a closer relationship with you.

2025-09-26.content: Today's text presents a powerful dialogue between God and his people. God declares his unwavering character: "I am the Lord; I do not change". Moreover, He challenges the people's unfaithfulness, their questioning of his justice, and their disobedience in offerings and tithes. The verses highlight the importance of commitment and faithfulness through the concept of tithes and offerings. This isn't just about material things, but also about recognizing that everything we have comes from God and expressing our gratitude and trust through our actions. However, in the midst of the warnings, God offers hope. He invites the people to return and to test his faithfulness through generosity. He also promises abundant blessings if they return. Imagine a farmer questioning the value of planting seeds due to past droughts. Our passage reminds us that God, unlike seasons, remains reliable. He is the ever-present source of blessings, waiting for us to cultivate our trust through faithful actions. Are we questioning God's promises like the people in Malachi?. Are we holding back and doubting his provision?. Maybe it's time to plant a seed of trust through an act of generosity, big or small. Remember, it's not about gaining God's favour, but about aligning our hearts with his love and experiencing the joy of giving.
2025-09-26.prayer: Lord, forgive me my doubt and disobedience and help me renew my commitment to you to experience the blessings of your faithfulness.

2025-09-27.topic: A DAY OF RECKONING AND RENEWAL
2025-09-27.content: Malachi's final chapter paints a clear picture of contrasting destinies. The wicked face a day of judgment and destruction while those who fear and honor God experience hope and restoration. This passage offers a powerful message about choices, consequences, and the unshaking love of God. The metaphor of a burning oven serves as a clear warning against arrogance and evil. It reminds us that our actions have consequences and that choosing the wrong path leads to destruction. In contrast, God offers a beacon of hope - the sun of righteousness which signifies salvation, healing, and joy for those who remain faithful. It reminds us that God's love and grace are ever-present, offering new beginnings even in the midst of darkness. If we can accept the grace through the Lord Jesus Christ, we can escape judgment and destruction and allow the sun of righteousness transform our hearts and deliver us from the danger ahead. Are you ready to face the judgement or will you surrender to Jesus and enjoy total freedom with the fullest of Joy? Make the choice today!.
2025-09-27.prayer: Lord, grant me the wisdom to discern between right and wrong, the courage to choose your path, and the strength to endure life's challenges with faith.

2025-09-28.content: This passage paints love as a textile woven with threads of different colors and textures. It describes a vibrant picture of Christian living, where love is the central thread binding everything together. The beauty of Christianity can only come out when we exhibit genuine agape love of Jesus Christ. Love is not just superficial affection, but a deep, authentic commitment to the well-being of others. It goes beyond personal gains and seeks the good of the community. It is the love which manifests in concrete actions like honouring others, offering hospitality, and sharing with those in need. However, as we obey the will of God in showing this love, we are going to face persecution, suffering, and conflict. As Christians, we are called to respond with blessings, perseverance, and a commitment to peace. Recognizing our limitations and associating with everyone, regardless of their status, brings unity and breaks down barriers. We are not called to retaliate, but to conquer evil with good, choosing forgiveness and patience over anger and revenge.
2025-09-28.prayer: Dear Lord, empower me to live according to your teachings. Grant me the strength to choose love, even when it's difficult.

2025-09-29.content: Our text describes the commissioning of the Disciples by Jesus on a challenging mission to the lost sheep of Israel. This commissioning shows the disciples' responsibility within their community and reminds us to focus on our spheres of influence and share the Gospel with those around us. We are all on a mission to our community and are instructed to avoid material possessions but rather put our trust in God's provision as we live with a spirit of detachment as Jesus instructed the Disciples. Jesus described the mission as sending a sheep to the wolf's den - preparing our minds that we are going to face potential rejections, persecution, and danger. Yet, Jesus equipped the disciples with clear instructions and powerful promises and their message was one of hope and healing, proclaiming the arrival of the Kingdom of Heaven. Rejection and persecution were expected, but the disciples were not to respond negatively. This reminds us to stand firm in our faith while maintaining peace and love, even in the face of opposition. Despite the challenges, we are promised guidance and strength from the Holy Spirit. This emphasises our reliance on God's power and presence in our journeys.
2025-09-29.prayer: Teach me Lord to be faithful to fulfil the mission you have sent me on, Amen!.

2025-09-30.topic: STANDING VICTORIOUS IN THE FACE OF SPIRITUAL WARFARE
2025-09-30.content: This passage from Revelation presents a dramatic battle between good and evil, symbolised by Michael and the dragon. This shows us the reality of spiritual warfare. There is an ongoing intense spiritual struggle between good and evil, over our soul and destiny. Our battle is not against the flesh but against forces of darkness represented by devils and demons. Their main aim is to make sure we are not on the path to heaven and that our faith is wrecked. Thanks be to God for the ultimate victory of God and his people, offering hope and inspiration despite the challenges we are facing in this present world. We are not alone in this battle, Christ is with us, as is the host of heaven. We must recognise the power in the blood of Jesus Christ as a force that will bring the ultimate victory of God's power and love over evil and darkness. The power of the blood of Jesus emphasises that our victory is rooted in the blood of the Lamb, representing the sacrifice of Jesus and its power to overcome sin and death. The people who overcome are those who stand firm in their faith and testimony, even in the face of persecution and death.
2025-09-30.prayer: Dear Lord, please give me strength and courage to face my battles with faith and hope.

2025-10-01.content: I once heard of a church that had bypassed the PHCN meter to enable them use electricity without paying for it. Sometimes, people do this because a member of that church works with the power distribution company, or that they have one form of 'connection' or the other. I have heard of wives of officers in the military or para-military driving without vehicle or driver's license. And the boast is that "no one will harass you; you're the wife of an officer.". While one may get away with such because of 'connections', it is not right for a disciple of Jesus to behave so. We do the right things because we belong to the Lord, who is not disorderly; we do the right things because it is the right thing to do; we do the right things because we fear God and for the sake of our conscience. Verse 5 of our text stresses it: Therefore, you must be subject, not only because of wrath but also for conscience sake. Note the word 'must'; it is actively playing a crucial role there. So, you must do what is good. You're supposed to have, as up to date, it is Christian to do so. Remember that Jesus was not disorderly; as a matter of fact, He paid his taxes, and even paid for Peter.
2025-10-01.action: Rise and make amends where necessary!.

2025-10-02.content: As I sat listening to testimony after testimony of the faithful labours of Brother Gideon, who had served the Lord for many years in the ministry, I wondered if I will have such a testimony at the close of my pilgrimage here on earth. And to say the truth, I knew the things being said of the brother were true. My experience relating with him in the past thirty-eight years was not different. I knew I could easily say the same things about him; he was quite selfless. He had served creditably in the ministry and now he was gone. In verse 2 of our text, Paul was clear that he was writing "To the saints and faithful brethren in Christ who are in Colosse.". Can this be said of you where you're living?. Are you faithfully following the Lord?. One of the touching things is that this was being said about an entire congregation. I wonder if there are congregations today that the Holy Spirit can bear 'a wholesale testimony' that all in the local assembly are 'faithful brethren.'. And yet, this was said of men, flesh and blood, not spirits. The journey to having an assembly of faithful brethren starts with each member deciding to be a faithful follower of Christ, as I believe Gideon was. If you are faithful and I am faithful, then we will have a faithful assembly.
2025-10-02.prayer: Lord, May I indeed be a true soldier of Christ.

2025-10-03.content: Many today desire to be leaders in God's house. In our communion, it seems many in the holy orders see the bishopric as the ultimate that must be aspired for, and campaigned for, if necessary. The word 'bishop' in our passage can mean overseer. While it is not wrong to desire to be a leader in God's house, it must never be at all costs. It is interesting to note that there are qualifications for leaders, as we see in today's passage. For one, the person must have a good testimony (within and outside the church), and there are ways to measure this. For one, he must be gentle, not quarrelsome. It may be easy for many not to be quarrelsome outside. But what about at home?. A quarrelsome man at home, often in disagreement with his wife and other family members, is not qualified to lead God's people. A man known for quick temper should also not aspire for leadership office in God's house. Moreover, one who is desiring the office of a bishop must be humble. Pride is what ruined Satan and can also destroy a Christian leader. Pride has to do with an open consciousness of your perceived worth; it has to do with an over-emphasised opinion of one's self. The testimony of Bishop Samuel Ajayi Crowther's service points to the direction of a humble service, rendered in one of the most trying circumstances. Dare we be different?.
2025-10-03.prayer: O, for a humble heart I pray.

2025-10-04.topic: FILLED WITH THE KNOWLEDGE OF GOD'S WILL
2025-10-04.content: I wondered what to do with a young man who had just committed his life to Christ. How do I find time in the midst of many personal engagements and activities to disciple him?. What times should I schedule to study and pray with him?. I found that what the Holy Spirit will have me do first is to bend my knees on his account. I needed to begin to earnestly pray for him, committing him and his new found faith to the One who alone could keep him. It was in doing this that I found God giving me an insight into how to raise him for the kingdom. Paul's first reaction to the news of the faith of the Colossians should be an instruction to us on what to do and how to proceed when there is a new believer or group of new believers: "For this reason we also, since the day we heard it, do not cease to pray for you, and to ask that you may be filled with the knowledge of His will in all wisdom and spiritual understanding" (v.9). Have you learnt to pray this prayer for yourself and others?. A believer that is filled with the knowledge of God's will as well as spiritual understanding will do well.
2025-10-04.prayer: Dear Lord, help me to genuinely pray for myself as well as others.

2025-10-05.content: I stood at the entrance of the mechanic workshop where my car was being fixed. A young spare parts dealer walked up to me and asked: Is that car being fixed by Emma, yours?. I said yes. He immediately said, "You're lucky o!". I asked what he meant and his answer surprised me. He informed me that they (spare part dealers) have an understanding with the mechanics; they add their own 'cuts' to the prize of parts. But according to him, Emma will refuse, insisting that the real prize be told the customer. All this while, Emma did not hear the conversation but it increased my respect for his decision to live as the Christian I knew him to be. John was specific about what will make the world know that we are true followers of Christ: "He who says he abides in him ought himself also to walk just as He walked" (v.6). The acid test for a disciple of Christ is living Christ's life. The world ought to see the character of Christ being lived out by us; in a sense, we are the letters that Jesus has written to the world. They ought to see Jesus in us as they did in Antioch and called believers there Christians. Are you living out his life?.

2025-10-06.content: I know of a believer who was a bit tense as he approached his first-degree exams; he wanted to graduate with honors, at least a second-class upper division. He eventually made it and discovered he felt no different. He thought a Master's degree would give him that boost; he finished his masters and discovered the world did not change. A Ph.D might just be the magic he needed; but he finished that also without feeling on top of the world. As he discovered, only a proper relationship with Christ gave him the inner joy he needed to move through life. This experience has been the story of many. And the reason is very simple: He (Jesus) is before all things, and in him alone all things hold together (v.17). Even life itself cannot hold together outside him. The pursuit of worldly goods and achievements do no guarantee ultimate happiness; political power does not guarantee it either. Same goes for fame. We were created for him, and only in him can we ever find fulfillment. Determine today to pursue a proper relationship with Christ; it is your only guaranteed means of finding fulfillment in this world. All other things will fail.
2025-10-06.action: Determine to stand on Christ, the solid ground; all other ground is sinking sand.

2025-10-07.content: Sometimes, I wonder why non-believers do the things they do; I wonder how someone will not see that a certain habit, character or lifestyle, is harmful. I have wondered why some people dress terribly, for example, and not see that it reduces the perception of their dignity. I did this until it dawned on me that but for Christ, I will not be different. I will not be worse than the people I wonder about. I believe this goes for all of us who are the disciples of Christ. The way Christ has so washed our lives and changed our values makes us forget that we are the way we are only because He washed and changed us. He killed the appetite for sin in us, making us hate what non-believers seem to like.

2025-10-08.topic: DISCOMFORT FOR THE SAKE OF CHRIST
2025-10-08.content: As I waited for the ferry to arrive, I thought of the dangers of crossing the river in high current. I thought of the last time I passed this way and the ferry engine died in the middle of the journey. I thought of the terribly bad road I have to travel in for hours before getting to the more manageable section of the road back home. I had gone to preach and this was the only reason I was going through this experience. Paul the apostle knew this kind of hardship, even more. He endeavoured to preach Christ in places where He had not been named; he (Paul) was in danger at sea, on land and even among the Jews; all for the gospel. Paul's conviction and attitude to all his suffering is worth noting, worth emulating and worth preaching in today's world filled with the gospel of no suffering, only physical prosperity. Hear him clearly saying: "I now rejoice in my suffering for you...for the sake of His body, which is the church, of which I became a minister" (vv. 24-25). Would you consider suffering discomfort for the sake of Christ a let-down?. Can you endure hardship for the sake of the gospel?. What is your understanding of true spiritual prosperity?. Remember, the mystery Paul talked about is 'Christ in you, the hope of glory'.
2025-10-08.prayer: Lord, may I yield to all you have for me in the gospel, even if it involves some discomfort.

2025-10-09.content: In a very credible sense, one of the clearest things as one goes through the New Testament is the fact that you lose your independence once you become a Christian. As you sign up to follow Christ, be prepared to let go your own ideas and principles, your own interests and pursuits, your own biases and attachments. You must now walk in him, live in him and live for him alone. Anything less is not acceptable. Hear Paul again firmly insisting: "As you therefore have received Christ Jesus the Lord, so walk in Him, rooted and built up in Him and established in the faith" (vv. 6-7). A few implications emerge here as what is required once you receive Christ: (i) Walk in him: You are no longer allowed to walk/live the way you want; your steps must now be clearly taken in Christ, not according to the expectations of the world system. Your life can no longer be lived to fulfil the expectations of men, not even your own personal expectations, but the expectations of Christ. Are you living according to his expectations?. (ii) Rooted and built up in him: The roots of your private and public choices must now be in Christ; the considerations for your choices must now be him. (iii) Established in the faith: You must be formed now in the faith, not on the expectations of the world system.
2025-10-09.prayer: Lord, please, have your way in me.

2025-10-10.content: One of the common expressions today in Nigeria is 'your village people'. This has somehow become the valid explanation of many concerning any challenge they are going through. Even when one does not want to believe this of what s/he is going through, others insist on his behalf that is the only logical explanation for passing through any undesirable experience. My worry is that this belief has created fear in the minds of many a Christian; it seems to be elevating the powers of evil; and it gets Christians preoccupied with activities to stop 'village people' rather than bearing a authentic witness for Christ. Is this not a contradiction?. What Scripture clearly teaches, point in a very different direction: "... having wiped out the handwriting of ordinances against us, which was contrary to us" (v. 14). No sin is greater than the blood of Christ; his blood can cleanse any sin. No power, covenant or curse is greater than the cross of Christ; his cross brought us victory over all the powers of the evil one. Next time you hear, 'your village people are pursuing you,' insist that according to Scripture, it is goodness and mercy that is following you. Your life in Christ is insured if you will rise up in faith and live for him.
2025-10-10.action: Insist that no weapon formed against you shall prosper.

2025-10-11.content: The Colossian Christians needed to be warned by God in this letter, especially in regard to philosophical and religious appearances and perceptions. In verses 16 and 17 of this chapter, Christians are warned not to let anyone judge them by physical standards of food or religious festivals and celebrations. They were not to be manipulated by outward religious appearances or high-sounding but empty philosophical wisdom of men. All these are not the reality but a shadow. The real substance of spirituality is found in Christ alone, not in some religiosity that does not have any real substance, or high-sounding philosophies, or any other manifestations and human achievements. The only hope for a sound spirituality recognised by God is for one to get connected and reconnected with the "head", Christ Jesus. No amount of religiosity, no quantity of human efforts can make a person right before God. Only connection with Christ - a total submission to the Lordship of Jesus - can achieve that. Jesus himself said "... apart from me you can do nothing" (John 15:5). Real life, real wisdom, real relationships, and real spirituality can only be found in Christ.
2025-10-11.prayer: Lord, thank you for making me understand that real life and real wisdom can only be found in you. I acknowledge you as my Lord and my reality, Amen.

2025-10-12.topic: LIVING WITH THE END IN MIND
2025-10-12.content: There is an unfortunate way in which some people live today. They live in ignorance of the fact that life is temporary and passes on quickly. However, despite this ignorance, everyone comes to their end, with time. God never meant for life on this earth to be permanent. Unfortunately, many live life with the philosophy that their stay on earth is permanent. Ultimately, they will be disappointed one day when they realise that their lives have come to an abrupt end. They will feel worse when they find themselves standing to be judged by God in regard to the life they chose to live on earth. Knowing that life is temporal and the end of all things draws near, how then should God's people live in the here and now?. (i) God's children must be always alert, sober-minded and prayerful. They are not to be carried away by the material things of this world, or by the tricks of Satan. (ii) They must live to show acts of love, which ought to manifest, among other things in: hospitality without grumbling, use of gifts to serve others, deliberately employing the words they speak as instruments of God in edifying others. They must also avoid careless utterances that destroy people, while they invest their lives in service to God and God's people. Finally, they must do everything to bring praise and honour to Christ always.
2025-10-12.prayer: Lord, help me to live my life and do all things always remembering that the end is near, Amen!.

2025-10-13.content: The born-again life of a Christian has been described in certain ways. In Colossians 2:20, Paul says that the Christian "died with Christ.". In our text today, he says that Christians have been "raised with Christ" (v.1). In other words, when a person genuinely gives his/her life to Christ, he/she first of all dies to the worldly attitude to life; and is then raised with Christ to the heavenly attitude towards life. Being born-again involves a drastic disconnection in the attitude towards the world and its manner of living, and a another drastic connection in attitude towards heaven and its manner of living. Attitude is what makes the difference!. Those who are truly raised with Christ and are genuinely born-again demonstrate that new status by their lifestyles, passions and desires. On the other hand, those who are not born-again, or who only pretend to be, are identified by the way their passions and desires cling to the world and all it offers. Such people are often willing to compromise godly moral standards in order to gain the treasures of the world. Jesus says 'What shall it profit a man if he gains the whole world, and loses his own soul? Or what will a man give in exchange for his life?' (Mark 8:36-37) .
2025-10-13.prayer: Lord, I acknowledge that nothing in this world is more valuable than my soul. Help me to always set my heart on the things of heaven, Amen!.

2025-10-14.content: Yesterday we considered what it means to die with Christ and be raised with him, which is the born-again life. In our text today, the Lord shows to us very clearly the way and manner of life lived by those who are not "dead and raised" with Christ, but whose hearts are set on this world and its treasures. The characteristics of an earthly-minded person include sexual immorality, impurity, lust, evil desires, greed, anger, rage, malice, slander, filthy language, lies, etc. Apostle Paul describes these same negative worldly qualities when he wrote on the "acts of the flesh" to the Christians at Galatia (Gal. 5:19-21). This is a very serious matter as the wrath of God will come on those who live by such ungodly practices. Child of God, do not allow yourself to become a candidate of God's wrath. Rather, rid yourself of such ungodly habits by embracing the love of God in Christ Jesus. Faith in Christ and submission to his Lordship over your life can save you and lift you above the wrath of God that is coming upon the children of disobedience.
2025-10-14.prayer: Lord, I disengage from every hidden sin in my life. Take them away from me and nail them permanently to your cross, and give me a brand-new life, Amen!.

2025-10-15.topic: THE WAYS OF THE TRULY BORN AGAIN
2025-10-15.content: Earlier in the chapter, Paul pointed out some of the practices of those who are not genuinely born-again, whose hearts are set on the earth and its worldly ways. In a similar way, our passage today explains to us that the ways of those who are truly born-again, are obviously different. The practices of heavenly-minded believers manifest themselves in much more admirable and commendable qualities. Note the following: (i) They joyfully and sincerely clothe themselves with compassion, kindness, humility, gentleness, and patience towards others. (ii) They are quick to forgive, always remembering that they themselves are also beneficiaries of God's mercy and forgiveness. (iii) They seek for peace always, and are themselves at peace with all people and in all circumstances. (iv) They are a thankful people, in all circumstances and at all times. (v) They cherish the gospel of Christ and are always affected by it, and they also seize every opportunity to use their gifts and talents to build up others in Christ. (vi) They are always motivated to do all for Christ's glory and for Christ alone. (vii) Their hearts are always ruled and motivated by the love of Christ. Does this picture reflect your life as a Christian? If not, do something about it!.
2025-10-15.prayer: Lord, mat the virtues of the Christ life find expression in my life, Amen!

2025-10-16.content: There are certain behaviours, attitudes and practices that make Christians and their families unique and admirable. Our passage today tells us how best we can conduct ourselves towards each other in family relationships in a way that will attract glory for Christ. When we obey these principles, we will build godly, healthy and joyful families, and by extension a better and healthier society. First, wives are instructed to submit themselves to their husbands, and this is fitting and pleasing to the Lord. In a world filled with twisted cultural mindsets and the theories of feminism, it is becoming increasingly hard for many wives to obey this principle. But if a Christian family must glorify God, this principle is a must. Note that the wife is called upon to submit herself to her husband willingly and not by force. Her action should be a free-will decision because she loves the Lord. A wife cannot truly love Christ without showing that love through submission to her husband. Second, husbands are to love their wives the way Christ loved his Church and gave himself up for her (Eph. 5:25). This is a self-giving and self-sacrificing kind of love. Moreover, Christian children are to obey their parents ; and parents are to raise and train their children with firmness, patience and love.
2025-10-16.prayer: Lord, may my family truly glorify you, Amen!

2025-10-17.content: In continuation of our meditation on God's instructions for Christian households, we focus today on employees. At the time that this letter was written, different forms of slavery were part of the cultural practices of the world, especially the Roman world ; so, it was common to find slaves who had converted to Christianity from pagan backgrounds. God was challenging them to see their condition of slavery as an opportunity to showcase their faith as Christians. They were therefore instructed to be obedient to their masters in everything, as long as it did not go against the principles of their faith. They were not to give themselves to eye-service, but be sincere and diligent in carrying out their duties. They were to always view their work as an opportunity for service, not to men but to God, knowing that God is the ultimate rewarder. Slavery may not be in practice among us today literally as it was then, but what about our work ethic today? Do you grumble, murmur and complain in your place of service?  Bear in mind that although you may be in the employment and on the pay roll of men today, the ultimate employer of every man is God. Therefore, do everything as unto God.
2025-10-17.prayer: Lord, help me to do all things to the glory of your name, Amen!

2025-10-18.content: Paul died for his faith during one of the persecutions that broke out in Rome under Emperor Nero. Our passage is very clear that even before his death, Paul was aware that the time was drawing to a close. Yet, he was not shaken by fear as he faced his coming end ; he looked forward to his end with such a quiet confidence and glowing anticipation of his heavenly destination. Paul gives the answers to the questions of how you can be equally assured and confident of the prospect of eternity and your final destination  to young Timothy. (i) Do not be confused or distracted by the attractions of this world or by the situations you face as a Christian. (ii) Endure every hardship that comes to you as a result of your faith in Christ. Every genuine faith in Christ must be tested by the fire of troubles. (iii) Be a faithful evangelist and a witness to the gospel of Christ wherever you find yourself. (iv) Be a faithful and trustworthy minister of Christ in your calling and vocation. (v) Christianity is warfare against sin and Satan, therefore, fight your good fight. As a Christian, when you practise and maintain your faith in this way, you can be confident that your everlasting crown will certainly await you in heaven.

2025-10-19.topic: LIVING BY FAITH, NOT BY SIGHT
2025-10-19.content: God's creation of the entire universe and everything in it was a fragile process. This includes the nature of the human body. Paul uses 'earthly tent' to describe the human body. In contrast, he also describes the new body to be received in eternity in stronger and more enduring terms , saying 'we have a building from God, an eternal house in heaven, not built by human hands' (v.lb). While it is good and necessary to take good care of this earthly physical body, it is, however foolish, to do so while neglecting your soul which has eternal value. Many today treat their physical bodies like a god, but treat their souls like a trash bin. Those who live by sight alone see their body and the physical things of this world as permanent and final, therefore, they invest their devotion, time, resources and loyalty to them, forgetting that time and circumstances will happen to these things and they will fade away. But those who live by faith in Christ cherish their souls and invest in every possible way to maintain its health and sanctity, making it ready for its heavenly destination.
2025-10-19.prayer: Lord, help me care well for my spirit.

2025-10-20.content: Paul described the Christians at Colossae as 'God's Holy people'. They are also described as 'faithful brothers and sisters' (v.2). There are certain qualities that are noticeable in the Colossian Christians, qualities that each of us should seek to be known by. The first is faith in Christ (v.4a). This made these Christians to stand out as distinct before God and before men. No one can come to God and be accepted by him without faith in Christ. Another quality of this people was their love for all God's people (v.4). Faith in Christ can only be genuine and effective if it expresses itself in unconditional love towards people. Furthermore, these were a people whose hope was heaven. To be recognized as holy before God, we must constantly live with eternity in view. We are not to live carelessly or recklessly, but each day loving God and man and seeking to please God in all our ways.
2025-10-20.prayer: Dear Lord, please help me live to please you, Amen!

2025-10-21.content: Partnership and team work are important requirements in ministry. When members of the body of Christ work together, it reflects or shows the very nature of the triune God and how He designed his Church to function. During his missionary exploits, Paul didn't do it all alone but had several companions who offered help and encouragement all the way. His ministry was effective and successful because of the helpful people whose commitment did not shake. His team members had different backgrounds (Jews and Gentiles), and played different roles (messengers, helpers, physicians, prayer warriors, slaves, burden bearers). Each played a significant role and Paul commended them publicly. Beloved, you need to be part of a team when it comes to doing God's work in whatever local church you attend so as to fulfil God's purposes for his church. God wants to use you and all you need to do is submit yourself to him. Don't complain about your shortcomings because there is no such thing as one who is more significant or qualified than others in a team. God uses the efforts of each team member in equally important, unique and special ways. You can't live the Christ-centred life on your own as alone.
2025-10-21.prayer: Dear Lord, give me the grace to serve faithfully as a team member, Amen!

2025-10-22.content: Using four critical commands, Paul concluded his epistle with a charge concerning the ways that the Colossians themselves were to serve (vv. 15-18). He communicated a desire for fellowship with the churches in Colossae and Laodicea ; then a desire for the circulation of his letters between the churches (highlighting the importance of the Word in the life of the church) ; an encouragement to a specific member of the church (Archippus) concerning the call of God upon his life so that he would fulfil it ; and a final exhortation regarding prayer - that they should pray for him in his prison chains. From these final verses, we learn much about how we are to build up unity with one another in God's service. Believers in Christ should love and cooperate with one another, sharing the precious word of God within the church family and among the brethren! This tells the rest of the world that Jesus is our Lord. We are to pray for, support, encourage, respect and exhort one another towards faithful service and fulfilment of our calling. So much of the success of God's work and that of his faithful workers, depends on our prayers. With this and the grace of God in our midst, the church will flourish.
2025-10-22.prayer: Dear Lord, unite your church in your service through Christ our Lord, Amen!

2025-10-23.content: Today is the Feast of St. James of Jerusalem. He was the brother of our Lord (Mark 6:3), yet Jesus' brothers didn't initially believe in him or accept his ministry (John 7:5). James believed only after the resurrection - when Jesus showed himself to him. That was enough to convert him. James realised that he had been wrong all along. He later became a leader in the church at Jerusalem, so much so that Paul referred to him as a pillar of the church. God used James to do a lot for his church in Jerusalem. James contributed a lot towards the resolution of the controversial issue at the Jerusalem Council. His leadership was steady, mature, and based on Scripture. James' story shows what God's grace can do in a person's life. It can take an unbeliever and turn them into a devoted servant of the Lord as it did to James (from doubting Jesus to leading the most influential church in Jerusalem and guiding and defending God's people with God's Word). If Jesus did it for James, He will do it for them too. Only let your knees be bent in prayer on their behalf. Pray that they will be saved while God's grace lasts.
2025-10-23.prayer: Dear Lord, please rescue the unbelieving and the perishing by the same grace you extended to James, Amen!

2025-10-24.content: One of the wonderful moral tools God puts in a man is the conscience. A guilty conscience is a relentless pursuer, driving a person to flee from imaginary threats and to avoid unseen eyes. This is the case of the wicked who engages in praising wickedness, oppression, and injustice because of selfishness. Even when no one is actually threatening them, the wicked, prompted by a guilty conscience, shame and fear of judgment, become fearful and suspicious of everyone. This happens to them because God is not pleased with them. God's righteous ones are however confident and bold - standing even when persecuted for Christ's sake. They are bold as a lion because God upholds them. They know that his grace is bigger than any mistake, and his forgiveness more powerful than any guilt. You can be bold and courageous by turning to Christ who sets free from all sin, guilt, shame and fear. Jesus washes from all wickedness and makes the righteous face anything with confidence and boldness. Dip yourself in the truth of God's love. When you understand the depth of his love for you, guilt loses its grip. When you realise that you are covered by his grace, fear dies.
2025-10-24.prayer: Father, help me to be bold on account of your provision, strength, grace, and help.

2025-10-25.content: The fear of the Lord is the beginning of wisdom, and to fear God is to recognise sin for what it is and to want to be on the right side of God's judgment. The one who fears God lives with the mindfulness of his absolute holiness and hatred of sin. They also honour God with their lives, recognising that they will stand before him to be judged based on their faithfulness as believers (2 Cor. 5:10). Thus, they do not lead God's children astray (v.10) , do not boast in their wealth (v.11) , praise righteous deeds, are just and fair, and administer justice to all when in leadership (vv. 12, 15). They quickly confess and forsake their sins (v.13). The man who fears the Lord will be honoured in due time by the Lord, if not in this life, then in eternity. Those who fear the Lord sow seeds of life and will have a glorious harvest with abundant spiritual fruit and rewards. They will have access to every spiritual blessing and eternal riches in Christ. The fear of God begins with accepting Jesus Christ as your Lord and Saviour. Those who harden their hearts and reject Christ will find disaster and eternal catastrophe as they are judged on the last day. Their eternity will be misery in hell. Therefore, fear the Lord and walk in his ways while you have the opportunity.
2025-10-25.prayer: Lord, may I truly fear you, Amen!

2025-10-26.content: This passage reminds Christians that we are children of God and therefore, heirs of God who will receive God's inheritance. God owns everything, and his children come into the inheritance of what He owns. This is a great promise - the security of the child of God. Because of our adoption by God, we are now children of God, with an assurance of freedom from fear (v.15) , intimacy with the Father (v.15) , assurance of belonging (v.16)  and inheritance with Christ (v.17). Those who belong to Christ have the Holy Spirit. And the Holy Spirit testifies that we are children of God. The same Spirit convicts us of our sins, humbles us to hate sin and makes us cry out in need of the Father. If you belong to the Father, you have an eternal inheritance with him. Therefore, you must live a transparent and honest life. Let it show that you are a child of God. Hate sin; in fact, fight against it. God's children do not continue to sin. Remember that the path to glory was not without its sufferings for Jesus (Luke 24:26). But if you suffer with him, you shall also be glorified together with him (v.17). As co-heirs with Christ, the only way to come into your immeasurably great inheritance is through suffering. Therefore, you endure!
2025-10-26.prayer: Lord, awaken the witness of the Holy Spirit within me and cause me to hate sin in my life, Amen!

2025-10-27.content: A popular scheme in the world today is the get-rich-quick scheme! Even in the church, prosperity-preaching anchored on Luke 6:38a can be heard more frequently than the call to repentance. It is used as a lottery ticket or investment that guarantees huge returns. But today's passage teaches that it is wrong to rush after shortcuts to become rich, only to fall into errors (vv. 21-23). Such shortcuts include favouritism, bribery, neglecting the needy, taking advantage of others, stealing, etc. These all result in false riches and have consequences. True riches come from honest hard work and showing kindness and love towards others in need. Be careful that you do not run into trouble. Be on guard against all kinds of greed and shortcuts to wealth. Such wealth is false and does not last. Seek to be rich toward God thereby laying up treasure for yourself in heaven. Through honest hard work and love, built in your heart for the poor and needy, God will supply your needs (Phil. 4:19) ; and this will not be taken away from you. Instead of pursuing wealth that does not satisfy, seek first to be rich in the kingdom of God and to trust him to meet your needs.
2025-10-27.prayer: Dear Father, deliver me from greed and the love of money, Amen.

2025-10-28.content: Today we celebrate the feasts of Saint Simon and Saint Jude, two of the twelve apostles. From the little we know about them, we can find an example of what it means to love one another and to strive for the faith. They went on to be faithful witnesses of the saving power of Jesus. They were not so famous but they faithfully followed the cause of the Lord Jesus. They started out as regular people like you and I, but through their relationship with Christ, they went on to do great things - striving for the one, true and only faith. Now Jude charges us to contend for the true faith which source is the word of God. Those who pervert the word of God or refuse to believe it, shall be condemned. Beloved, there may be many people around you that are not truly saved. But while you pray for their salvation, do not judge them. Just heed the warnings of Scripture and contend for the faith as the apostles did. If this faith matters to you, and if it defines you, and it is a priority for you, you will be obliged to defend it. You must strive for the faith that He has blessed us with as we wait eagerly for His coming.
2025-10-28.prayer: Father, help me to be zealous and faithful in making known your love and mercy, Amen!

2025-10-29.content: To be stiff-necked is to refuse to ignore warnings about sin, and disregard God's Law by continuing in rebellion against him. Those who do so are at peace with their sins - having being trapped by it. They get flattered by sin (v.5)  and think they can be happier if they govern themselves (v.2) , comfort themselves, even if through wastages (v.3)  and find their own practical solutions to their problems. They feel smart and self-sufficient. But they forget the consequences of such continued rebellion against God. If you have been warned about sin in your life - listen to that warning! Never ever ignore God's repeated warnings. God is not happy with those who are stubborn and rebellious to his warnings. He is only being patient with you to lead you to repentance. However, those who continue to resist God after many calls to repentance, those who see their rebellion clearly and yet continue willfully in sin, will finally receive the consequences of sin. Jesus patiently calls you to submit to his authority - to turn from sin and obey his word. His desire is to bless you.
2025-10-29.prayer: Lord, please deliver me from all wilful sin and help me submit to your authority, Amen!

2025-10-30.content: Every choice we make in life has consequences which are due rewards or just punishment for the choices and decisions. Many of our troubles occur because we make choices based on unreliable authorities such as culture, tradition or emotions. Solomon tells us that the wicked will flourish, grow or prosper, for a time, but eventually, they will meet their downfall. They will receive the consequences for their sinful choices someday. Unfortunately, some Christians are frustrated as it appears the wicked seem to get away with their sins without consequences. Some wonder why they should abstain from evil. But remember, there is always a consequence to your choices. If you choose to be wicked, God will deal with you in his time and in his way. If you choose to ignore God's ways, hurting those around you, eventually, you will face the consequences of your choice in this life or in eternity. God will surely deal with those who choose to sin. Nobody will ever escape the consequences of their choices (Psa. 37:1-6). When you see sin multiplying, run from it and trust God to deal with it in his time and in his way. Find a way to stop the wickedness by focusing on your own choices - making sure they are in line with God's word. Choose righteous living and stand for it.
2025-10-30.prayer: Dear Lord, help me to always make choices in life that will glorify your name, Amen!

2025-10-31.content: One of the burdens of every man is the fear of his fellow man. We so much fear man's disapproval, rebuke and discipline. In fact, it's such that many would rather offend God than man, and seek man's approval than God's. This fear can so weaken us not to take action and keep us silent when we should speak. It feels powerful, but its power is deceptive. That's why Proverbs 29:25 tells us, 'The fear of man brings snare, but whoever trusts in the LORD shall be safe.'  This means that the fear of man is an evil trap. That is why both Moses and Jesus commanded us to love and fear the Lord, not man (Deut. 6:5; Matt 22:37). Remember, you obey the one that you fear and you ascribe the most authority to the person you fear most. As a Christian, you are to fear God and seek the eternal reward and approval that He gives. Fear the terrible eternal curse of God's disapproval more than insignificant man's disapproval. The fear of the Lord is safe because He really is God and He alone can destroy both the soul and body in hell. Lay aside every fear of man by confessing your fear of man as sin to God, and repent. Don't fear what people think, fear what God thinks.
2025-10-31.prayer: Dear Lord, deliver me from the fear of man and help me to fear, love and trust you always, Amen.

2025-11-01.content: On All Saints' Day, we reflect on the lives of the canonized saints. These are holy persons believed to have special grace in character and ministry. In our church, the Apostles and those who believed the Lord when He was in flesh on earth are especially celebrated as Saints. These saints serve as examples for us who are still in the race. We must end in heaven as Saints triumphant. Our salvation is an entry point in our Christian life, and we are required to go on to maturity. Our consecration should be a daily process. The basic faith actions listed in the text, which include learning to know God better, developing perseverance, doing God's will, and loving others, must be a continual part of our Christian life. Our salvation does not depend on good works, but it results in good works.
2025-11-01.prayer: Help me Lord to show devotion to the things that will help me to grow in my faith, Amen!

2025-11-02.content: All Soul's Day is a day set aside to celebrate the life and ministry of other saints who have died and are now awaiting the resurrection morning.
