In today's passage, Jesus speaks about the events of the End Time, including the resurrection of the dead in Christ and His ability to both resurrect and judge them. Unbelievers will also be resurrected. The kind of resurrection each person experiences depends on the life they lived before death. We should learn to subject our lives and will to the will of God. Those who believe in God and His word will not be subjected to judgment.
2025-11-02.prayer: Help me Lord to totally subject my life and my will to you, Amen!

2025-11-03.content: Death is a reality. Apostle Paul addressed the Thessalonian Christians' concern about the fate of their fellow believers who had died by pointing out that every Christian has a glorious hope. The Christian hope is based on the return of Jesus Christ. Those who are dead will rise on the resurrection day. The greatest asset you have as a Christian is your faith, and you must sacrifice everything to keep it. Let the assurance of hope He gives strengthen your faith in God.
2025-11-03.prayer: Rock of ages, cleft for me and let me hide myself in thee.

2025-11-04.content: God is infinite, and certain aspects of His nature will always remain a mystery. We can only know God as He has revealed Himself to us, mostly through His words. To attempt to add to what has been written is unacceptable; God will rebuke anyone who tries because they are a liar. The writer of the text asks God to make him honest and not to allow him to be too poor or too rich. This shows a desire to be focused on his purpose for living. Devote time daily to know God more and more through His word. Perfect peace and joy only come from living a God-approved life.
2025-11-04.prayer: Help me Lord, to remain faithful in my fellowship with you, today and always, Amen!

2025-11-05.content: Our text gives a true picture of our present generation, where people think they can do whatever they wish without consequences. It is a generation that curses its father and does not bless its mother. It is also a generation that is pure in its own eyes but is not washed from its filthiness. The passage deals with the sin of ingratitude, which is common in these last days. Ingratitude manifests when our love for God and our fellow humans grows cold. We honor men and appreciate God when we obey His words. We must set a good example for others and devote our lives to doing things that please God.
2025-11-05.prayer: Help me, dear Lord, to constantly follow the pathway of honour.

2025-11-06.content: Man's wisdom and understanding have limitations. The writer of the text points out things that are yet to be fully known, such as how eagles fly, how snakes crawl on rocks, how ships sail, and the ways of a man and virgin. Despite this, God reveals what He wants us to know through His words. Everything is created for a purpose, and the major purpose is for God's pleasure. As a person, you are created to bring pleasure to God.
2025-11-06.prayer: I thank you Lord for your interest in me. Help me to always bring pleasure to you, Amen!

2025-11-07.content: Everything we need to live a successful life is in the Bible. The text exposes us to basic realities that can help us improve our lives. We can learn from the ant about good preparation and saving for times of scarcity. From badgers, we learn to make strong and secured places to live in. Locusts teach us cooperation and order. From the spider, we learn to be fearless and bold. Lack of planning can lead to fear of retirement. Gambling is not a way to build one's fortune. We must learn from these creatures to be proactive and safety-conscious and to shun fear and inferiority complex.
2025-11-07.prayer: Ask God to help you to be diligent in your business and to plan your life intentionally.

2025-11-08.content: Our views about our lives and identities influence how we live. As a royal priesthood, your daily lifestyle must be Christ-like. Don't engage in anything that will destroy your relationship with God. The influence of wine and improper dealing with the opposite sex can make you lose your sense of direction. You have a future and a kingdom to protect, and you need to guard it jealously.
2025-11-08.prayer: Merciful God, keep watch over me and save my life from wrong, Amen!

2025-11-09.content: If we want to withstand the present challenges to our Christian faith, we need to deepen our personal relationship with God. The Christian faith demands all from a believer, and divided loyalty is not part of the system. Apostle Paul was not afraid to die because he was confident of where he would spend eternity. Every believer will be subjected to judgment and there will be rewards and consequences for our actions. We are no longer expected to live for ourselves but for Him who died and rose again. Do not gamble with your life and establish an intentional method of building your Christian faith.
2025-11-09.prayer: Take my life and let it be, consecrated Lord to thee.

2025-11-10.content: The woman described in our reading is a picture of a woman with qualities every Christian woman should strive for. The virtuous wife is a blessing to her family, and the heart of her husband trusts her. She is concerned with making her home comfortable. A woman or man in a marriage who cannot be trusted takes some measures of blessings out of the home. In Proverbs 14:1, the wise woman builds her home, while the foolish pulls it down with her hands. It will be difficult for lasting peace to reign where trust is constantly betrayed. You need to put your house in order so that God can partner with your family to produce godly children.
2025-11-10.prayer: Ask God to help you to build the family that attracts his interest.

2025-11-11.content: A person who needs peace must learn the secret of having peace. Our text contains basic lessons that can help families build healthy homes. The virtuous woman takes responsibility by rising early to prepare food for her household. She also makes investments in family interests and is a merchant with a commitment to family wellbeing. The change needed to make your home glorious is in your hands. Show commitment as the wife or husband that God has trusted to build a promising home. Give service and commendation where it is required.
2025-11-11.prayer: Heavenly Father, may I never disappoint you in your great trust upon me in my family responsibilities, Amen!

2025-11-12.content: A person who is blessed is required to be a blessing to others. The virtuous woman extends her hand to the poor and reaches out to the needy. Many people do not realize that part of the reason they are blessed is to be a blessing to others. In the case of the virtuous woman, her life brought honor to her husband. She is also a seamstress and a merchant. Be successful for the people around you and let your progress in life impact those who need help. Be resourceful and productive within your capacity.
2025-11-12.prayer: Heavenly Father, help me to put my resources and gifts on things that will please you, Amen!

2025-11-13.content: Good works have a reward, and bad works have consequences. The virtuous woman who served others is now being served and honored. Her children and husband rise up and call her blessed. Physical appearance never counted for her, but strength, efficiency, and ability did. Be a living example of good works and win the trust of people by rendering selfless service. Set good standards in every opportunity you have to serve.
2025-11-13.prayer: Ask God to bless you and make you a channel of blessings to others.

2025-11-14.content: The devil is described as the dragon, the ancient serpent, the devil, and Satan. He is under the sovereign authority and control of Christ until God's purpose for you are fulfilled. Fear not, for it is your Father's good pleasure to give you the kingdom. You are safe under God's guidance, and the power of evil only operates by divine consent. Build your faith and trust in God.
2025-11-14.prayer: Thank you Lord for my victory through the death and resurrection of Jesus Christ.

2025-11-15.content: This text is an account of the reign of the saints while Satan is bound. Those who suffer with Christ will reign with him. This is called the First Resurrection, and the second death has no power over them. Those who have a part in the First Resurrection are blessed and holy. Outside of this, the rest of the dead will not live again until the thousand years are finished. You have the chance today to enroll yourself into the kingdom citizenship by accepting Jesus as the Lord of your life. You must not sacrifice eternity for any reason. The pathway might be narrow, but you must strive to enter.
2025-11-15.prayer: Help me, dear Lord to live with eternity in view daily, Amen!

2025-11-16.content: John wrote the gospel so that Christians would believe in Jesus and have eternal life. You can know for certain that you have eternal life if you believe God's truth and in His Son, Jesus Christ. Eternal life is based on facts, not feelings or speculations. God's will is the key to answered prayers. When we pray, we should not demand what we want, but ask in accordance with what God wants for us. God knows what is good for us more than we do. If we align our prayers to God's will, He will hear us and give us definite answers.
2025-11-16.prayer: Dear Lord, please let my will be lost in Your will. Speak to reassure me; speak and make me to listen; Amen.

2025-11-17.content: Satan's threats will one day cease forever, and peace will reign. After a thousand years of imprisonment, Satan will be released to gather an army against God's people, but fire will come down from heaven and consume the attacking army. Christians are assured that God's word must come to fulfillment. The devil will be thrown into a burning lake of fire to join the beast and false prophets, and they will be tormented forever. Satan's power and wickedness are not forever; he will be thrown into the lake of fire and will never be a threat again.
2025-11-17.prayer: Dear Lord, help me to firmly believe in You, and be totally committed to You forever, Amen!

2025-11-18.content: The judgment of God will surely come to pass. The dead, great and small, will stand before the Great White Throne of God, and books will be opened, including the Book of Life. The Book of Life contains the names of all who committed their lives to Christ and put their trust in Him to save them. It also contains the records of every person's work, good or bad. Those whose names are not found in the Book of Life will be thrown into the lake of fire. Our works are evidence of our faith, salvation, and relationship with God. Commit yourself to doing good works, helping the poor and needy. Use your gifts and talents to serve the Lord and live a life of righteousness. Be careful about what you think, say, or do, knowing that one day the Book will be opened.
2025-11-18.prayer: Dear Lord, take my life, and let it be consecrated to you.

2025-11-19.topic: NO MORE DEATH; NO MORE SORROW!
2025-11-19.content: Our passage speaks of a new heaven and a new earth that the Lord will make when the old ones have passed away. God and His children, whose names are in the Book of Life, will be together to live there forever. If you persist to the end and unite with the Lord, God will wipe away tears from your eyes, and there will be no more death, sorrow, crying, or pain. Suffering, diseases, and poverty will be gone forever. You must rid yourself of all dirt, impurity, and uncleanness to unite with God. Those who fail to unite with the Lord will be thrown into hell fire where they will burn forever. If you haven't made peace with the Lord, do it quickly now to escape the wrath to come.
2025-11-19.prayer: Father, give me the courage to say 'No' to sin, and 'Yes' to righteousness, Amen!

2025-11-20.content: The beauty of Harvard University Medical College cannot be compared to the beauty of heaven. Today's text is a beautiful description of the Holy City, the new Jerusalem, which is a place of perfect holiness and indescribable beauty. The foundation is garnished with all manner of precious stones. The New Jerusalem is a picture of God's future home for His people. Jesus assured us that there are many mansions in His Father's house and that He was going to prepare a place for us. Knowing that nothing defiled or unclean will enter the kingdom of God, we must get ourselves rid of such things that are capable of preventing us from entering and dwelling in this holy city.
2025-11-20.prayer: Father, please help me to prepare to meet You in the new Jerusalem, Amen!

2025-11-21.content: The holy Jerusalem will not need the sun, moon, stars or electricity because the glory of God will give light to the city, and Jesus Christ is its eternal light. Because there will always be light, darkness and sin will not exist. Not everyone will enter the New Jerusalem. Idolaters, adulterers, fornicators, liars, the wicked, envious, jealous, thieves, cowards, cheats, fraudsters, the occult, and those who do abominable things and reject Jesus will not be allowed in. Your marital status, wealth, education, political affiliation, gender, tribe, or race cannot grant you entry. The only qualification for entry is having your name written in the Lamb's Book of Life.
2025-11-21.prayer: I want to live eternal life; God save my soul.

2025-11-22.topic: NO MORE CURSE; NO MORE SICKNESS
2025-11-22.content: When Adam and Eve sinned, God placed curses on them and drove them out of the Garden of Eden so they could not eat from the tree of life. In the New Jerusalem, the issue of sin has been dealt with through Jesus' blood, so there will be no sin. We will eat freely from the tree of life and live forever with God. In that city, there will be no sickness or curse, and nothing accursed will exist. Curses brought by sin and misbehavior will never exist again. There will be real joy and perfect freedom. These revelations are pure and true and will surely come to pass.
2025-11-22.prayer: Dear Lord, please grant me the strength and grace to live for you, and to enter the New Jerusalem, Amen.

2025-11-23.content: Jesus is coming quickly, and those who keep the sayings of the prophecy are blessed. You can make yourself ready by keeping God's word. If you are living in sin, you will not desire the coming of the Lord. When John fell to worship an angel, the angel forbade him, stating he was a fellow servant and instructing John to worship God. The text warns against leaders who desire to be worshipped by others, as this is tampering with God's glory. We should point people to Jesus Christ, the Author and Finisher of our faith.
2025-11-23.prayer: Almighty God, incline my heart to give You all the glory, and point men to you, Amen.

2025-11-24.content: The expression 'I am coming quickly' shows the nearness and certainty of Christ's return. He will surely come with his reward and will pay everyone according to their work. The reward will depend on the type of work done on earth. Good work, such as serving God sincerely, helping the poor and sick, will be rewarded, while bad work, like living in sin, fighting, cheating, and stealing, will not.
2025-11-24.prayer: Dear Lord, help me to do good work as I wait for your coming, Amen!

2025-11-25.content: Jesus sent his angel to give the message to the churches. The Spirit and the Bride (Church) say, 'come'. Verse 17 extends an open invitation to anyone who is thirsty to drink freely from the water of life. Jesus is the one who gives this living water. All sinners are invited to come to Jesus for salvation and peace. A warning is given against deliberately distorting the word of God for selfish purposes, as serious punishment awaits such people.
2025-11-25.prayer: Dear Jesus, I am thirsty; please give me salvation and fill me with righteousness and joy of salvation, Amen!

2025-11-26.content: God is light, and in him, there is no darkness at all. Light symbolizes what is good, pure, and holy, while darkness signifies evil and sin. If a person claims to be a Christian but lives in sin, they are a pretender. The evidence of fellowship with God is walking in the light. To stay refreshed as a Christian, you must have fellowship with one another, as the blood of Jesus cleanses from all sin and keeps us pure. You should resolve to regularly pray, study the bible, and attend church services.
2025-11-26.prayer: Dear Father, help me to walk in the light and develop an intimate relationship with you.

2025-11-27.content: John wrote this letter to discourage believers from living in sin because sin kills. We should not take our salvation for granted by living sinful lives. If we deliberately continue to sin after receiving knowledge of the truth, there is no longer a sacrifice to cover our sins. However, if we sin, we must immediately repent and confess to God, as Jesus Christ is the sacrifice that atones for our sins. The true evidence of Christianity is keeping God's commandments, which are summarized as love for God and for his people. If you love God, you will not intentionally sin against him.
2025-11-27.prayer: Dear Lord, have mercy on me and incline my heart to keep your commandments, Amen!

2025-11-28.content: Love is both an old and new commandment. It is an old commandment from Leviticus 19:18 and a new commandment from Jesus in John 13:34, which is expressed through selfless giving, sacrifice, and doing good to your enemies. Love is the mark of Christianity, and by loving others, all men will know we are Jesus' disciples. Anyone who hates their brother or neighbor is not a Christian but is walking in darkness. We are advised not to love the world or the things in it, as the world will perish.
2025-11-28.prayer: Heavenly Father, help me to love others through my actions. Help me to yield my members and desires to you, Amen!

2025-11-29.content: The emergence of antichrists is a sign of the end times. These antichrists are liars who deny that Jesus is the Christ, deny his Lordship, and deny the Father and the Son. They deny the deity of Jesus Christ and that he came in a real body. Many cultists claim to be Christians but do not believe Jesus is divine. They may use adulterated bibles or perform rituals with the blood of animals. Anyone who rejects Jesus is an antichrist. You should watch out for and avoid people who perform rituals with incantations, animal blood, and candles, as they are not of God. If you receive or encourage their false teachings, you will partake in their wickedness.
2025-11-29.prayer: Dear Lord, watch over me so that I do not go astray from the truth. Keep me shining in all I think, speak or do.

2025-11-30.content: Advent Sunday marks the start of the Advent season, a period of anticipation and preparation for the second coming of Jesus Christ. Jesus is coming quickly, and there is a blessing for those who will keep the prophecy of the Bible. Christ's second coming is a sure prophecy that will certainly come to pass. You can make yourself ready by keeping the faith of Jesus. When you begin to keep God's word, you will find yourself desiring the coming of the Lord.
2025-11-30.prayer: Almighty God, incline my heart to keep Your word in preparation for Christ's second coming. Amen.

2025-12-01.content: Andrew was a fisherman, who hailed from Bethsaida in Galilee (John 1:44), but was called into special grace by Jesus Christ. He was one of the Twelve that became Apostles as chosen by the Lord; he is honoured with the title Protokletos (First-Called) in the church, because being initially a disciple of John the Baptist, he was one of the two that first recognized and followed Jesus as the Messiah, and introduced his brother Simon Peter to him (John 1:40, 41). Whenever you find Andrew in John's gospel, he is bringing somebody to Jesus: his brother, the lad with the loaves and fish (John 6:8-9), and the Greeks who wanted to see Jesus (John 12:20-21). No sermons from Andrew are recorded, but he certainly preached great sermons by his actions as a personal soul winner. As we celebrate him today, let us think of how we can become closer companions of Jesus through our daily and intentional study of the word, and prayers. These will empower us to bring more people to Christ by our personal touch in words and actions, and the Kingdom of God will be enlarged by our efforts.
2025-12-01.prayer: Lord, endow me with special grace as I draw closer to You day by day. Amen!

2025-12-02.content: Many persons have often wondered the justification for suicide. A particular service provider has "Life is Beautiful" as its advertisement slogan. The question always is: Why will someone want to kill him/herself in the midst of this beauty?  My response has always been that when hope is lost, anything negative is possible. No matter how difficult life may be, a man of hope will get going. Our passage today speaks of the manner of love that God has for his children, and the expectation of being like Christ when we shall behold him at the end of time. The idea of becoming like Christ fascinated John so much that he was ready to pay any price to actualise it. This was the ground of his hope; it was not temporal but completely eternal. In the hope of being like Christ, he was willing to pursue the purity required. The evidence of our sincere desire to becoming like Christ is seen in our commitment to be pure. Until we begin to pursue purity, our profession of the Second Coming, the Millennial Reign and the Reunion with Christ is nothing but pretence.
2025-12-02.prayer: Lord, purify me until I become like You, Amen!

2025-12-03.content: In recent times, the doctrine of "Once Saved, Always Saved, often referred to as 'OSAS' gospel, continues to downplay the grievousness of sin; with the wrong belief that one cannot lose his/her salvation. However, we must remember that God cannot behold iniquity and that no sinner can inherit the kingdom of God. Therefore the issue of sin has to be dealt with. From John's account in this passage, sin can NOT accompany the spiritual birth. Sin cannot co-exist with a believer who is born of the spirit. John stresses two important issues, which I can term the "drug and vaccination" against sin. The vaccination is the issue of the spiritual birth which deposits a part of God - the seed of God - in us. The drug is the fact that we remain in Christ. This is the ANTIDOTE to sin. It makes it impossible for us to sin. We cannot claim righteousness outside of Christ.
2025-12-03.prayer: Dear Lord, please help me to remain in You so that I do not sin against You.

2025-12-04.content: This passage brings another perspective into our understanding of 'love.'  The apostle presented 'love' as a transporter which knows no barrier. It breaks barriers and demarcations. The confirmation of our destination is shown by the love we possess. Love is a spiritual transmission-agent that changes a man's location; from death to life. At the exit gate of death, love is the ticket required for passage. Love is that thing that empties a man (v.17), even of his blood, for the sake of his neighbour. The language of love is sacrifice; it is expressed not in word but in deed. There is no price it cannot pay; there is no gate it cannot open; there is no weakness it cannot tolerate; there is no offence it cannot forgive and there is no evil it cannot overcome. A demonstration of love is an assurance that we are living in the truth of God's word and it is the insurance of our hearts in the presence of God. Beloved, what sacrifice have you made for God and for man to reflect the kind of force which can only be seen in God's love?
2025-12-04.prayer: Lord, please give me true love for divinity that can be reflected in humanity.

2025-12-05.topic: THE CENTRALITY OF THE HUMANITY OF CHRIST
2025-12-05.content: The humanity of Christ speaks about the complete human nature that Christ assumed at his incarnation. It explains the adequacy of his representation as the holy contact by which our humanity meets God. A part of the Nicene Creed is dedicated to this truth. It states that "he became incarnate from the Virgin Mary, and was made man. For our sake he was crucified under Pontius Pilate; he suffered death and was buried."  The acceptance of his substitutionary death - taking the place of man - is built on the fact that He was FULLY man. So, the teaching of Docetism (denying the reality of Christ's full humanity), goes to the root of our salvation. This truth of Christ's full humanity also brings out the humiliation he undertook for our redemption; that God was made man. It also made Christ a PERFECT EXAMPLE as one who has shared a common experience and has become touched by the feelings of our infirmities. The implication of these is that on the last day; no man shall be with any excuse of not living the victorious Christian life. It is possible and it has been proven.
2025-12-05.prayer: Lord, You took on my form to save me, help me to take your form to be eternally saved.

2025-12-06.content: The most profound definition of love is found here. It says GOD IS LOVE. There are many virtues we talk about but none equals God, save love. No wonder Paul, in writing to the Galatians, says the fruit of the Spirit is love. Therefore, no man can be termed godly or spiritual who does not possess love. John said the gift of God's only begotten Son, Jesus, as an appeasement, was provoked by the love that God has for us. The example here is that God gave his best to secure our redemption. It is expected that we give our best to ensure that everyone around us is reconciled to his/her Maker. While it is lawful to give gifts to men and meet their material needs; we must say that the authenticity and power of our love is demonstrated in our investments to have others saved from darkness to light.
2025-12-06.prayer: Lord, refine me by your love and cause me to be defined by it, Amen!

2025-12-07.topic: DARKNESS IN THE MIDST OF LIGHT
2025-12-07.content: Advent focuses on John the Baptist, the Gentiles being included in God's family, Christ's coming in judgment and peace, and the church's hopeful expectation of the completion of his promises. Today's passage is one of the Messianic prophecies of Isaiah. It partly says: "The people who dwelt in darkness have seen a great light."  Jesus' birth brought the fulfillment of this prophecy. John later said of Him: "... in Him was life and the life was the light of men" (John 1:4). Before the creation of the 1st Adam, the world was full of darkness; without form and void. And God said 'let there be light and there was light.'  Similarly, before the coming of the 2nd Adam (the Great Light), the earth was filled with spiritual darkness. However, though all who sat in darkness saw the great light, there was no guaranty that they all left darkness. Though darkness did not comprehend the light, the light did not "kill" darkness. Darkness left the public space where the light appeared and entered into the private residence prepared by men who loved darkness. Beloved, darkness has lost its legal authority over you by Christ's birth and death. As we look forward to another Christmas, let us ask the Lord to shed His light in every darkened spot in our lives.
2025-12-07.prayer: Lord, may I experience You, the Great Light, to the fullest and in its fullness, Amen!

2025-12-08.content: One can secure obedience by the use of force or threat of punishment. However, true obedience comes from conviction or faith. In this passage, we see that love and obedience are more like Siemen twins that cannot be separated. No man can say he has love for God when he disobeys God's instructions. There is nothing we cannot give up when love is involved. When we love God, our lusts and evil pleasures will be easy to abandon. John gave us an equation that can help us examine ourselves daily. He says if we love God, we must love God's children. One way to know that we have love is when we obey God's commandments. John also said that it is not possible to love God if we are not born of God. He added that if we are not born of God, we cannot overcome the world . and we cannot be born of God until we first believe that Jesus is the Son of God. We must believe in His immaculate conception and in His deity.
2025-12-08.prayer: Lord, help me to become rooted in my faith and love for You.

2025-12-09.topic: DO NOT BE DECEIVED, KEEP YOURSELF
2025-12-09.content: This exhortation has become necessary amidst the lust and loose living which have crept into the congregation of the saints. In the debate of whether a man can lose his salvation or not, this message becomes very critical. In verse 18 Paul says: We know that whoever is born of God does not sin; but he who has been born of God keeps himself, and the wicked one does not touch him. This verse sums up the 3-way relationship on the matter of our salvation. When we become born of God and abide in Christ, it becomes impossible to sin. Our responsibility is to ensure we keep ourselves in Christ, otherwise, the wicked one will touch us; and when he does, we will sin. John further admonishes: We know that we are of God but we have a duty to keep ourselves; lest we lose our identity and thereby lose our security.
2025-12-09.prayer: Lord, please keep me secured in You; may I not stray away from Your presence.

2025-12-10.content: Over the last couple of days, our meditations have in one way or the other, been related to love. There is something that God must be telling us. We know that if we take love away from Christianity, what may be left would be Judaism. Love is the bedrock of Christianity. John was never able to leave off the message of love. Even in his 2nd epistle, he pleaded in verse 5: "And now I plead with you, lady, not as though I wrote a new commandment to you, but that which we have had from the beginning: that we love one another."  There is nothing more and there is nothing new we can say until we all come to understand, appreciate and imbibe the spirit of love which is the trademark of our Christian faith. If we say we are Christians, if we say we are born of God, if we desire to overcome the world, then we must show forth and share love to the brethren. Until we all become an embodiment of love, the church will be far from perfection.
2025-12-10.prayer: Dear Lord, may nothing else show forth from my life except you love, Amen!

2025-12-11.topic: LOOK TO YOURSELF THAT WE LOSE NOT
2025-12-11.content: This is a note of caution from the Apostle on the back of the activities of false teachers and deceivers, amongst God's people. Those false teachers denied the humanity (the incarnation) of Christ. And for us today, they are those who teach the concept of sexual liberality, irresponsible Christianity, moral lousiness, feminism, etc. Some say that all you need to do is to confess Jesus Christ as your Lord and Saviour; and regardless of what you do afterwards, you will be fine. In order for us not to lose and be lost, John says we should look to ourselves. He said we should beware of being like them, thereby losing the prize that we have been working so hard to get. It is the reason Paul said to the Philippians (2:12-13): Work out our salvation with fear and trembling. He said to the Corinthians: Let him who thinks he stands take heed lest he fall (1Cor. 10:12). We should not become so unguarded to the point of missing our bearing.
2025-12-11.prayer: Lord, help me not to lose sight of the track you are leading me on, Amen!

2025-12-12.content: Gaius was probably a companion of John and a faithful member of the church. He was prominent enough to have been the addressee of this 3rd epistle. He was committed to the work of God and perhaps seen as the face of the church. John praised him for showing unselfish devotion to Christ, by providing accommodations for God's travelling servants. Gaius expended his resources to care for God's servants. Little wonder, the manner of John's prayer for him. Gaius, no doubt, was spiritually healthy. The NLT says: Dear friend, I am praying that all is well with you and that your body is as healthy as I KNOW your soul is. Verse 3 sums it up: "Some of the brothers travelling by have made me very happy by telling me that your life stays clean and true; and that you are living by the standards of the gospel. Beloved, what is your testimony before the brethren? Can it provoke further prayers on your behalf; just like John did for Gaius when he said: "I wish that thou mayest prosper in all things and be in health..."
2025-12-12.prayer: Lord, may my testimony be soul-lifting and life-changing.

2025-12-13.content: These two characters were obviously notable personalities in that local assembly, similar to those we can refer to as prominent members of the Parish Church Council or Diocesan Board. Diotrephes was a spoiler who used malicious words to instigate the brethren to reject God's servants (the missionaries). He was so terrible that he would launch persecution against those who found reasons to accommodate the brethren. He denied the entire church of her role of hospitality. On the contrary, John spoke about Demetrius who was of a sweet spirit, and had a good testimony. He was not lured or influenced by the activities of Diotrephes but made himself accountable to the truth of God's word. In all, John had an admonition for Gaius specifically and by application, for the Church in general. He said: Dear friend, don't let this bad example influence you. Follow only what is good.
2025-12-13.prayer: Lord, make me a person of positive influence and increase my sphere of impact.

2025-12-14.content: Advent III is meant to remind us of the joy that the world experienced at the birth of Jesus, as well as the joy that the faithful have reached the midpoint of Advent. In this passage, the writer talks about the peculiar role of Christ in the present dispensation, as God's channel of communication, his superiority over the angels and men; and the honour that the Father bestowed on Him. He reveals to us the greatest title that any man can receive to be called "Son of God."  Today, we see a contrast by the indiscriminate chasing of titles and desperate search for recognition by believers, especially ministers. Today, some ministers prefer to replace the title 'Pastor' with 'Dr.' because they prefer to be known as those who have acquired great knowledge rather than those who have been called of God by a divine revelation. The body of Christ has invented many titles; some are even fearful and blasphemous!  Beloved, we need to pause, ponder and shift from the values built around the worldly system, to a kingdom mindset where sonship becomes the focus; ensuring that our relationship with the Father is intact.
2025-12-14.prayer: Lord, help me to constantly secure and value divine recognition, Amen!

2025-12-15.topic: DIVINE VISITATION AND THE MATTER OF LOCATION
2025-12-15.content: The story here is commonly referred to as the Annunciation of Jesus. But our focus is the remoteness of the location of this visit. It was Galilee, a place held in contempt because it was over-run with Gentiles. And specifically, to the small village of Nazareth, which was a hotbed of corruption. Remember the exclamation of Nathaniel when he heard about the Lord: "Can anything good come out of Nazareth?"  Nathaniel was living in a neighbouring city, so he knew so much about the corruption of Nazareth and the fact that nothing good was expected from it. Yet to this corrupt town, went Gabriel, bearing the world's greatest announcement. Rather than being influenced by the city, Mary radically altered the historical perspective of the place and giving birth to Jesus here permanently changed the outlook of the city, in time and in eternity. Today, we call Him Jesus of Nazareth. This is to encourage us that God's visitation is not determined by location. We do not need to 'japa' before we can receive divine visitation.
2025-12-15.prayer: Lord, position me for your recognition and visitation.

2025-12-16.content: There are several seemingly impossible stories in the Bible. We have the stories of a flood that covered the earth, a sea divided so people can walk through, the sun that keeps shining until a battle is won, and a man who survives three days in the belly of a fish. Similarly, in today's passage we read about the impossible story of God's angel who tells Mary that she would conceive in her womb through the direct operation of the Holy Spirit, who would overshadow her, notwithstanding that she was a virgin who had never had a sexual relationship with a man. However, Mary received the message with faith (v.38b). Indeed, God is the Creator of all things and can alter what He has created. He can break into natural laws and cause the supernatural to happen. Like Mary, we need faith that opens up new dimensions, making us understand that what we see is not all there is, and that with God all things are possible. By faith, we learn to recognise and appreciate the impossible things God does for us each day such as forgiveness, healing, provision, etc. The more we see the impossible acts of God with the eyes of faith, the stronger our faith in him will become.
2025-12-16.prayer: Father, grant me the eyes of faith to see You as the God of impossible things, Amen.

2025-12-17.content: Christian fellowship thrives on two essential pillars: a deep personal communion with God and a meaningful and loving relationship with fellow believers. These two arms of fellowship - vertical with the Divine and horizontal with humanity  together form the foundation of a vibrant, holistic Christian community. Today's passage focuses on the blessedness of believers fellowshipping with one another. And let us consider how to stir up one another to love and good works, not neglecting to meet together as it is the habit of some, but encouraging one another... (Hebrew 10: 24-25). Consequent upon Mary's angelic visitation as we have read in previous days (v 28-37), she thought it wise to visit her cousin Elizabeth to felicitate with her and possibly to render any needed assistance during her prenatal days (remember Elizabeth was pregnant at old age) (v7,24-6,39 & 56). However, a causal Christian fellowship soon gave birth to another dimension of spiritual edification and empowerment (v41-55). Friend, do you think Mary had it in her mind that her visit to her cousin was going further establish what Angel Gabriel said to her prior to the visit?  No, she simply went to fellowship!  Our horizontal fellowship with one another is as important as our vertical relationship with God. There are many benefits we stand to derive from it ; ranging from physical (services, encouragement, financial empowerment and bailouts, conflict resolution, sharing burden, correction and advise, etc.) to spiritual (intercession, Bible study, words of wisdom, etc.).
2025-12-17.action: Make up your mind today to commit yourself more deeply into fellowshipping with other believers.

2025-12-18.content: In today's text, we see God working His purpose out following Caesar Augustus's Decree that a census be conducted to register the people for tax purposes. Interestingly, the census went out in God's perfect timing and according to God's perfect plan to bring his Son into the world. Is it a coincidence that Jesus was born in the very town prophesied for his birth (Micah 5:2), even though his parents did not live there?  God was just working out His specific purpose through Joseph and Mary. Mary's song of joy reveals how well she knew God, for her thoughts were filled with God's words from the Old Testament (Luke 1:46-55). Similarly, Joseph is said to be a just (righteous) man (Matt. 1:19). So, Joseph and Mary knew God intimately, hence He ordered their steps (cf. Psalm 37:23), ending in them becoming the earthly parents of Jesus. God has a general purpose and a specific purpose for everyone. We exercise God's general purpose when we let the love of Jesus shine through us to make an impact on others - using effectively the spiritual gifts He has given us to make a positive contribution wherever we live. The more we fulfil our general purpose, the clearer our specific purpose will become, just as it happened with Joseph and Mary.
2025-12-18.prayer: Father, help me live for you daily so I can fulfil my specific assignments for You, Amen!

2025-12-19.content: Have you ever been sent to deliver a message that would gladden the heart of someone?  If yes, how did you feel after sharing the message?  This was the situation with the shepherds while watching over their flock by night, when an angel appeared to them to bring them good tidings (news) of great joy which would be to all people. The good news, it was announced, would bring great joy to all people. And what is the good news itself? "For there is born to you this day in the city of David a Saviour, who is Christ the Lord" (v.11). This is the message that is shared at Christmas. As the angel announced this good news to the shepherds, an innumerable company of angels joined in announcing this good news as they sing praises to God for His good-will to men, manifested in his sending of the Messiah (vv. 13,14). Since it is a matter of great joy to all people, the message of Christmas is not to be kept secret. The angel proclaimed it to the shepherds, the choir of angels sang it, so too you should proclaim it and sing it. Tell it to whoever you please. Proclaim it on the mountaintops; proclaim it in the valleys that Jesus Christ is born.
2025-12-19.prayer: Lord, may I not relent in sharing the good news this Christmas and beyond, Amen.

2025-12-20.content: The shepherds would stop at nothing until they confirmed the good news of the birth of Jesus which the Lord had made known to them. They had to journey in haste to Bethlehem where the baby was. Having found Mary and Joseph, and the Babe lying in a manger as revealed to them by the angel, the Bible says they spread the good news concerning the Baby Jesus (v.17). Notice three things that happened following the proclamation of the shepherds concerning the new born Baby. First, all those who heard the news marveledthey were amazed at what the shepherds told them (v.18). The Amplified Bible says those who heard it were astounded (shocked/greatly surprised) and wondered.  Yes, the Christmas story is no ordinary story! Share it to 'shock' or 'greatly surprise' someone such that it may lead that someone to Christ. Second, Mary pondered in her heart the visit of the shepherds (v.19). The message of Christmas can touch the heart to transform lives, so share it to transform the life of someone. Third, the shepherds returned glorifying and praising God for what they had heard and seen (v.20). Remember, the message of Christmas comes with 'great joy' (v.10). Share the good news with someone today so as to bring them great joy!
2025-12-20.prayer: Father, as I share the message of Christmas, may somebody be won for Christ, Amen!

2025-12-21.content: The Scripture enjoins Christians to be subject to governing authorities because the authorities that exist are established by God (Rom. 13:1 cf Titus 3:1; 1 Pet. 2:13). Jesus' parents were law-abiding Jews. They showed up at the temple to perform sacrifices associated with a wife's purification after birth, in line with the law that a son be circumcised on the eighth day (Luke 2:21 cf Lev. 12:2-4, 6). The Boy, Jesus, was therefore presented in the temple. This was done with an eye to the law, and at the time appointed by the law, when He was forty days old, when the days of the mother's purification were accomplished (Luke 2:22-23 cf Ex. 13:2,12). The mother also brought her offering "according to what is said in the law of the Lord" (Luke 2:24 cfExod. 13:2,12). Our God commands us to be law-abiding because all authorities that exist are appointed by Him. When we are obedient to the authorities, it is actually God we are obeying. However, we may choose to disobey man when what we are told to do does not glorify God (Acts 5:29). The Scriptures admonish us in particular to obey those who rule over us, and be submissive, because they watch out for our souls, as those who must give account; and when we obey them, it makes their work a joy and not a burden (cf Heb. 13:17). From today, make the work of those who lead you a joyful one by obeying them and you will be blessed for it.
2025-12-21.prayer: Father, as I obey constituted authorities, may Your glory be shed on my way, Amen!

2025-12-22.content: We read in Hebrews 9:27 thus, And as it is appointed for men to die once, but after this the judgment.  Until Christ's Second Coming, each one of us will continue to keep an appointment with death, that is, breathe our last breath. This was the experience of Simeon, a devout Jew who was looking for the 'consolation' or salvation (Luke 2:30) of Israel. And in verse 26 We read that the Holy Spirit revealed to Simeon that he would not see death until he had seen the Lord's Christ. True to this revelation, Simeon saw the infant Jesus as He was brought to the temple by Joseph and Mary to dedicate the Child (the Nunc Dimittis) and prophesied. Simeon could now die (breathe his last breath) in peace after seeing Jesus, who is the salvation of Israel (v.29). Beloved, like Simeon, we must resolve to have a personal encounter with Jesus before we take our last breath and depart this world. Not to do so is to miss the inheritance that can never perish, spoil or fade  an inheritance kept in heaven for Christians (1 Pet. 1:4). Be reminded that there is no repentance in the grave. Now is the day of salvation; tomorrow may be too late.
2025-12-22.prayer: Father, help me work out my salvation with fear and trembling before I breathe my last.

2025-12-23.topic: SERVING THE LORD UNTO OLD AGE
2025-12-23.content: We all pray to live long on earth. The Bible promises to grant the enjoyment of long life to those who honour their parents (Deut. 5:16 cf Eph. 6:2-3). The Lord also promises his continued love and never-ceasing care for the elderly when He says, Even to your old age, I am He, And even to gray hairs I will carry you! I have made, and I will bear; Even I will carry, and will deliver you (Isa. 46:4). We can see Anna hold on to this promise of being sustained by the Lord at old age, to serve Him. The grace of God was truly upon her, true to her name Anna which means 'grace.'  Her age has been variously reckoned from 84 to 105 years since she had been married for seven years, following which she had been a widow, either for 84 years or until her eighty-fourth year. Notice that even at very old age, she did not depart from the temple, but served God with fastings and prayers night and day (v.37). Let us pray the Father to bestow this same grace that was upon Anna on the aged ones today. It is not good that at retirement age, we become unproductive, especially in God's service. Grace makes the difference at old age, for we can still stay fresh and green.
2025-12-23.prayer: Father, grant that the aged ones ...will still bear fruit in old age...stay fresh and green (Psa. 92:14), in Jesus' name, Amen!

2025-12-24.content: Today is Christmas Eve and as from 12 midnight, we shall be wishing our loved ones 'Merry Christmas.' At Christmas, we often talk about why Jesus came into the world. But we can also talk about what God did not send His Son into the world to do: "For God did not send his Son into the world to condemn the world, but to save the world through him" (v.17). Yes, God did not send Jesus to condemn the world. Isn't that good news? Of course! This verse underlines for those who have doubts about the Christian faith who God really is. Many assume that God is always keen to 'condemn', but John is clear that the opposite is true. We are confronted with the challenge of our sinful state which requires judgement and condemnation. But we see in the whole of Scripture, God's redeeming plan which centres on the coming of Jesus. So, every Christian has the task of helping those who are confused about who God is and what He is like. Some think their sins are too grievous to be forgiven; that God had already condemned them. However, the God who sent His Son not to condemn the world but to save it, is the God of love, goodness and grace, and He desires to be our friend and lead us in abundant living. Jesus did not come to condemn the world - here is the message to share at Christmas.
2025-12-24.prayer: Father, thank You for Your good purposes for me and all humanity, Amen!

2025-12-25.content: We come once again to Christmas, and it's time to hear the truth of our faith. The Babe wrapped in swaddling clothes and lying in a manger is Almighty God who is born to struggle like a man with this world, and as He departs from it, He will carry with him forever, the marks of his humiliation. No other god can speak to our condition because no other god ever became flesh! This Jesus who is God became flesh and dwelt among men. It is remarkable that God himself would be this perfect sin-saving, peace-giving, light-shining leader, who would live among us and die to unite us fully with God. We gasp at such a revelation, but it's true. The Word has become flesh. And that is the meaning of Christmas. Can you see why we should sing our favourite carol today from the rooftops, as loudly as we dare, celebrating God's great love in sending Jesus?  Let the Christmas Word who has become flesh be our perfect teacher so that in his life, we may see how God thinks and how we should think. Let Him be our perfect example as a model of what we are to become, to show us how to live and give us the power to live that way ; and let him be our perfect sacrifice - He who came as a sacrifice for all sins, that his death may satisfy God's requirements for the removal of our sins.
2025-12-25.prayer: Lord Jesus, thank You for coming to us, living among us, and being our Saviour, Amen!

2025-12-26.content: Saint Stephen is the first Christian martyr, according to the New Testament (see Acts 6 & 7). He is recorded as standing out from the others in faith, grace, spiritual power, and wisdom (Acts 6:5, 8, 10). Stephen truly knew Christ and the power of his resurrection and participated in His sufferings, becoming like him in his death. Just as false accusations were brought against Jesus (Matt. 26:59-61; Mark 14:57-59), leading to his crucifixion, so too Stephen was falsely accused (Acts 6:11,13,14), and subsequently executed (Acts 7:58). Stephen prayed (Acts 7:60) as Jesus had done (Luke 23:34) for his persecutors to be forgiven. He also committed his soul into Christ's keeping (Acts 7:59) as Jesus committed his spirit into the Father's hands (cf. Luke 23:46). He met his end courageously, as Jesus, his Master, did. Stephen imitated Christ to the letter, hence we can say of him, "Like Christ, like Stephen."  Every Christian has been called to imitate Christ. After all, every Christian is a follower of Christ (Acts 11:26; 26:28; 1 Pet. 4:16). As we continue in the celebration of Christmas, put your name in the blank space provided here and see whether it fits in like that of Stephen: "Like Christ like ...." If it fits, praise God; and if not, pray to God passionately to be like Christ.
2025-12-26.prayer: Father, I receive the power to be like Christ, Amen!

2025-12-27.content: Today is set aside to commemorate St. John, the Evangelist and Apostle. John was among the first disciples Jesus called (Matt. 4:21-22; Mark 1:19-20). John's intimacy with Jesus earned him the expression, 'the disciple Jesus loved', such that he could lean on Jesus' breast at supper (John 21:20). The results of John's intimacy with Jesus include: (1) Being the first of the apostles to believe in the resurrection on the basis of what he saw in the empty tomb (John 20:8). (2) It was his insight that detected the risen Lord as the one responsible for the great catch of fish (John 21:7). (3) In Galatians 2:9, he is counted as a pillar of the Jerusalem church, along with Peter and James. (4) He wrote the Gospel according to St John (v.24), the three epistles of John, and the book of Revelations, all of which testify about Jesus. John's intimacy with Jesus as the beloved disciple helped him learn to understand the very heart of Jesus and do exploits for the kingdom. We can also become "beloved disciples" when we commune with Jesus through constant prayer, regular study of the Scriptures and fellowship with fellow believers. As we do so, the eyes of our hearts will be enlightened in order that we may know the hope to which the Lord has called us, the riches of his glorious inheritance in his holy people (Eph. 1:18).
2025-12-27.prayer: Lord Jesus, grant unto me all it takes to be the disciple You love, Amen!

2025-12-28.content: There is the popular saying that "When you fail to plan, you plan to fail."  When we read through the Book of Acts, we will discover that trials were common to first-century Christians. Some were mobbed, imprisoned, and even killed as a result of their faith. Knowing that persecution will certainly arise against Christians, Jesus had to prepare the minds of his followers in this regard, promising to send his Spirit to strengthen them when it happens (Luke 12:11-12). Here, Peter writes to encourage Christians who are suffering, not because of any wrongdoing of theirs, but as a result of attack on their faith, not to see suffering as "some strange thing" (v.12). This is not to say Christians should pray to encounter suffering. Far from it! Rather, they should expect it and prepare for it. Honestly, God's plan for your life may include pain and hardship. So, when trouble comes, don't be surprised but see it as a test of faith. James enjoins us to consider it "pure joy" when we face trials of many kinds (James 1:2). A sure way to prove that you are prepared when suffering comes, is not to ask God "why me?", but to ask Him to show you "how" you can use the suffering to glorify Him.
2025-12-28.prayer: Father, may every suffering I encounter, make my faith in you more mature, Amen!

2025-12-29.content: The slaughter of all male children two years old and under in Bethlehem and its environs by Herod the Great, in his effort to destroy the Christ Child (Matt. 2:16), is often commemorated as The Holy Innocents' Day. The children are innocent because they had done no wrong to warrant their deaths. In the midst of the rejoicing that a Saviour had been born (Luke 2:10-11), Matthew pauses to mark the heartbroken grief of the mothers who had lost their children as a result of Herod's jealousy (Matt. 2:13-18). Though Baby Jesus escaped the killings, which is good, the other babies paid the price of an evil man in a position of power. Just as it was a time of rejoicing when Jesus was born as well as a period of mourning because of the innocent young souls murdered, so too we have mixed feelings when we celebrate Christmas today. While some have joyful time with church and family, others have painful times full of loneliness and sorrow. When we face great pain, we need others to lament with us and mark those anniversaries. As the jollity of Christmas continues, let's pause like Matthew to remember those who face great pain and loss, whether that loss was yesterday or decades ago which becomes fresh in their memories every Christmas because it occurred during this season in time past. If that's you, know that God knows your grief; be comforted.
2025-12-29.prayer: Pray with Jeremiah 31:13b: "For I will turn their mourning to joy, Will comfort them, And make them rejoice rather than sorrow."

2025-12-30.content: Did you take notice of the expression, "full of grace and truth"? (v.14) . It tells us that there are no contradictions in Christ's character such grace and ungrace, truth and untruth. In Christ, there is grace and only grace; truth and only truth!  Whatever Jesus taught, that He also practised, for He never made any moral statement that He did not demonstrate in his life. Yes, Jesus is a perfect unified person!  Beloved, we all have flawed characters. Still, some of us are more flawed than others, for we have grace laced with ungrace, and truth laced with untruth. Very imperfect human beings we are - unconsciously displaying our imperfections sometimes. Therefore, we all need help from Christ, the perfect One, who has commanded us to be perfect even as our Father in heaven is perfect (Matt. 5:48). Good enough, grace and truth came through Christ to us (v.17). Do you know we have received from Christ grace that teaches us to say no to ungodliness and worldly passions? (Titus 2:11,12) . Do you also know that we have received grace that helps us to reign through righteousness? (Rom. 5:21) . Know it that we can grow to a stage in our spiritual development where there is far more grace than ungrace, and far more truth than untruth (cf 1 Pet. 3:18). Waste no time to tap from Christ's fullness of grace (v.16), to receive power to exhibit such qualities of character that can be described as nearly perfect since only Christ is perfect.
2025-12-30.prayer: Father, let the beauty of Jesus' character be seen also in me - now and evermore, Amen!

2025-12-31.content: On this last day of the year, we should pause to thank God and recognise that He has a track record of blessing us, providing for us, and protecting us. David in this psalm, considers what would have happened in the face of great enemy opposition against Israel if the Lord had not been on their side. He acknowledges God as their helper. So, he expresses grateful confidence in God who has provided escape both for him and his people. David concludes that help comes from the Lord, the great Creator. Beloved, let's look back to how the year 2025 began. If we are honest, we will reach the same conclusion with David that we would have been overwhelmed in the face of great enemy opposition if God had not provided escape from all our foes. Never mind if there are still heart desires of yours God has not attended to. As the year ends, resolve to rejoice in the LORD, the God of your salvation, "Though the fig tree may not blossom, Nor fruit be on the vines; Though the labor of the olive may fail, And the fields yield no food; Though the flock may be cut off from the fold, And there be no herd in the stalls "(Hab. 3:17-18). "Rejoice in the Lord always. Again I will say, rejoice!" (Phil. 4:4).
2025-12-31.prayer: Dear Father, thank you for bringing me to the last day of the year. Take my hand now and lead me into a year I will yet overflow with thanksgiving, Amen!
